results.description:
Valentine's weekend is almost here and it's the perfect time to get out there and find that special someone. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20s & 30s. That's why we've created this Valentine's event filled with more mature singles (40s & 50s)!  

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/4087/dates/Feb-13-2016_at_0730PM

Prepay Only Event. Tickets Not Sold At Door. 

What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers (8-9pm) 

• Drink Specials

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• 150+ singles in their 40s, 50s+ 

• Ice Breakers & Prizes 

*MUST PURCHASE TICKET IN ADVANCE HERE ($20) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/4087/dates/Feb-13-2016_at_0730PM

*Price goes up to $30 as the event date gets closer. We recommend getting tickets ASAP to save $ and guarantee your spot. This event will sell out, especially for women. 

• As date gets closer, we may shut down tix for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced.  Get tix ASAP to secure your spot, especially women.

• Typically 75% of attendees come alone (25% bring friends) 

• Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts) 

• MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. 100+ SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

PREPAY ONLY - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/4087/dates/Feb-13-2016_at_0730PM

results.description:
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

40 & Over Valentine Singles Mixer (Light Appetizers, Prizes, Ice Breakers)!

Wow - Valentine weekend is already here! Come on out and make it a great weekend at our 40 & Over Valentine Singles Mixer! We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars among a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Valentine Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!


THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

WHEN: Saturday, February 13th, 7:30 PM - 12:30 AM (If coming in from a distance, it's perfectly fine if you arrive at 8:00 or after)
WHERE: Pranna Lounge (79 Madison Avenue, at 28th St., NYC)

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 40s & 50s Plus Welcome To Attend
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM
* Icebreakers With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

results.description:
If you love wine and socializing then let us be your Valentine for this great night out where the focus is on introducing you to some great wines and other fun people!  

We have teamed up with several social networking groups to bring you a fantastic wine tasting event for both people who love wine and those who know nothing about it! 

It is a fun way to spend a Saturday evening in a classy yet casual atmosphere. The wine will be free flowing and you can fill your glass as many times as you would like if you love a particular one! 

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/winetasting/ 

The night will feature: 

• A dozen top notch wines selected by The World Bar/Madison & Vine Wine Bar wine experts for you to sample with descriptions of each

• Delicious Hot & Cold Appetizers

• Staff to welcome you and introduce you to others in group

• The bar will remain open for invited guests and wine tasting participants until midnight

PREPAY ONLY EVENT ($49, goes up to $55 as date gets closer)

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/winetasting/

Space is extremely limited! We already sold 20+ tickets so we only have less than 20 tickets left. Once they are gone, that's it! 

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

How many people attend? This is a multi-Meetup group event and we'll have 40-50 members attending. 

Is this age/ethnic specific? No. We'll have a wide range of ages attending. All are welcome 21+. 

What's dress code? Business/Neat Casual.

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/winetasting/
results.name: 6th Annual World Bar Wine Tasting: For Lovers of Socializing & Wine!

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

If you love wine and socializing then let us be your Valentine for this great night out where the focus is on introducing you to some great wines and other fun people!  We have teamed up with several social networking groups to bring you a fantastic wine tasting event for people who love wine and those who know nothing about it!  It is a fun way to spend a Saturday evening in a classy yet casual atmosphere. The wine will be free flowing and you can fill your glass as many times as you would like if you love a particular one!!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)  - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/6th-annual-world-bar-wine-tasting-party-for-lovers-of-socializing-wine-tickets-21292903648

The night will feature:

-A dozen top notch  wines selected by The World Bar/Madison & Vine Wine Bar wine experts for you to sample with descriptions of each.

-Delicious hot and cold appetizers.

-NYSN staff to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

-The bar will remain open for invited guests and wine tasting participants until midnight

What to wear: business casual, lounge

What to expect: 40-50 people. Most come on their own.

Tickets are non refundable unless the event is canceled.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)  - Get your tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/6th-annual-world-bar-wine-tasting-party-for-lovers-of-socializing-wine-tickets-21292903648


Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com. There will be other people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

Valentine's weekend is almost here and it's the perfect time to get out there and find that special someone. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20s & 30s. That's why we've created this Valentine's event filled with more mature singles (40s & 50s)!  

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/4087/dates/Feb-13-2016_at_0730PM

Prepay Only Event. Tickets Not Sold At Door. 

What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers (8-9pm) 

• Drink Specials

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• 150+ singles in their 40s, 50s+ 

• Ice Breakers & Prizes 

*MUST PURCHASE TICKET IN ADVANCE HERE ($20) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/4087/dates/Feb-13-2016_at_0730PM

*Price goes up to $30 as the event date gets closer. We recommend getting tickets ASAP to save $ and guarantee your spot. This event will sell out, especially for women. 

• As date gets closer, we may shut down tix for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced.  Get tix ASAP to secure your spot, especially women.

• Typically 75% of attendees come alone (25% bring friends) 

• Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts) 

• MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. 100+ SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

PREPAY ONLY - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/4087/dates/Feb-13-2016_at_0730PM

results.description:
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

40 & Over Valentine Singles Mixer (Light Appetizers, Prizes, Ice Breakers)!

Wow - Valentine weekend is already here! Come on out and make it a great weekend at our 40 & Over Valentine Singles Mixer! We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars among a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Valentine Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!


THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

WHEN: Saturday, February 13th, 7:30 PM - 12:30 AM (If coming in from a distance, it's perfectly fine if you arrive at 8:00 or after)
WHERE: Pranna Lounge (79 Madison Avenue, at 28th St., NYC)

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 40s & 50s Plus Welcome To Attend
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM
* Icebreakers With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

venue.name: YogaVida

results.description:
Dear community,

This Saturday night we highly recommend attending Pure Love ~ A Valentine’s Day Celebration. The night will include Partner Yoga, Transformational Dance, Thai Massage + a Chill After-Party.

This event is for Singles & Couples. It will take place on Saturday, February 13that YogaVida in NYC. My vibrant colleague Trinity is organizing it.

Come solo, with a friend, or your significant otherto celebrate, express and expand the love you have for yourself and others! This event will be a Celebration of all forms of Love- including Self-Love, Friendship and Romantic Love.

No partner is necessary! Everyone will be switching partners throughout the evening. If you prefer to stay with a partner you came with the whole evening that is welcomed as well.

The advance rate ends this Friday so get your tickets soon.

http://pure-love-valentines-celebration.eventbrite.com/?aff=J


Trinity is a vivacious, super fun and passionate holistic events organizer. I have attended several of her events and absolutely love the vibe and how they make me feel even more expressed, alive and connected to myself and others.

Trinity’s past few Valentine’s events have been mixed with half singles and couples. If you come solo you will not feel out of place. It is a very warm and welcoming community. Who knows you may also make a new friend or meet that special someone.


More info & register at-

http://pure-love-valentines-celebration.eventbrite.com/?aff=J


The Dancing Path™

is excited to present-


Pure Love - A Valentine’s Day Celebration

Transformational Dance, Partner Yoga& Thai Massage


+ Chill After Party


Facilitated by

Trinity & Kyoko Jasper


Saturday, February 13th

Doors open 7:45pm


8:00pm - 10pm

Transformational Dance, Partner Yoga & Thai Massage

10pm - 11pm

Chill After Party


Music, Mingling, Drinks & Chocolate

Complimentary Organic Chocolate provided by Raw Chocolate Love™


Complimentary Organic Juice Samples will be offered by Love Grace™

and Limeade drinks provided by Limation™.


===================

Singles, Couples and Friends are all welcome!


We will be celebrating love in all its forms


No partner is necessary!


We will be switching partners throughout the evening.


If you prefer to stay with a partner you came with the whole evening that is welcomed as well

No experience in Dance, Yoga or Thai Massage are necessary!

===================


Yoga Vida

666 Broadway ~ 3rd floor

(between Bleecker & Bond Street)]

Transformational Dance- Trinity will guide us through some free-form fun dance rituals around the theme of love. We will experience a heart dance as well as a special Valentine’s Dance that will help connect everyone in a playful, silly way enabling us to be more in our hearts instead of our heads. Many participants who have shared that they are normally intimidated by dance have shared how they were able to really let go and felt so much more uninhibited during Trinity’s dances.


Partner Yoga-Kyoko will guide us into fun partner yoga poses that will support us in connecting and stretching our bodies, as well as our movement creativity, communication and relationship skills. All levels are welcomed including those who are new to yoga. Doing yoga with a partner enables us to open our bodies more deeply than we could have alone. Plus it is super fun!

Thai Massage-You will practice & experience a simple, fun and restorative Thai Massage sequence that will relax, nurture and further open your body. Thai Massage originated in Thailandabout 2,500 years ago and was originally practiced in Buddhist Temples. It is practiced with Meta (aka loving kindness & compassionate touch). The recipient remains fully clothed throughout the massage and is guided through a series of stretches and hand compressions that are applied to open and balance the energy meridians of the body. It assists in loosening tight muscles and helps to create more overall peace and balance within the body.


Chill After Party- We will mingle with complimentary Organic Juices samples provided by LoveGrace™ and Limeade provided by Limation™. Raw Chocolate Love™ will provide complimentary samples of their beyond delicious organic, gluten-free and vegan chocolate.


Advance Registration is highly recommended!


$35. Advance (register by Friday Feb 12th)

http://pure-love-valentines-celebration.eventbrite.com/?aff=J

$40. Day of (cash at the door)


Link for pictures from last year’s event-


https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10204878641302286.1073741833.1127289530&type=1&l=372e4e38aa


Testimonials-“Trinity leads this outrageously fun facilitated celebration with all of her heart, passion, power, and love. By the end, I always feel completely connected with myself and everyone in the room- a deep sense of community is created. It is a profound experience.” ~Doug Larson


“I feel like this is the best time I've had in a while! I came in not knowing what to expect. I left feeling empowered, light, open, centered and free. A lot of things surfaced for me in a wonderful way. I now feel closer to my heart. Thank you!” ~ Melissa D.

====================


About Trinity- Trinity is the creator of the Dancing Path™ a celebratory transformational events organization that offers playful, creative, community building events, workshops and trainings all over NYC. She is passionate about bringing people together to celebrate life, express themselves fully and connect in fun and nurturing ways. One of Trinity’s main passions is to facilitate transformational dance. Her love and uninhibited passion for dance is infectious. Trinity has facilitated transformational dances at the Omega Institute, Princeton University, Jiva Mukti and many other wonderful places. In 2001 she studied Reiki and a few years later became a Reiki master. Shortly after Trinity studied at Institute for Integrative Nutrition (IIN) and got certified as a Holistic Health & Nutritional Counselor. During her studies at IIN she discovered Thai Massage and pursued training with Lotus Palm and in Thailand. Trinity is a 200 hour certified Yoga Instructor and has been teaching yoga for 15 years. She has also studied and been trained in Circus Yoga™, Hawaiian Lomi Lomi Massage, Authentic Relating & Deeksha aka the Oneness Blessing.

About Kyoko-Kyoko Jasper (ERYT) was born and raised in Japan, in 1985, she moved to NYC to become an actress and for over two decades, she has been performing in Musical Theatre, TV and Film. After the devastating day of[masked], led by an undeniable calling in her heart, Kyoko went through a dramatic shift which led her passion to a Yogic way of life. Now she is dedicating herself to spread peace and healing all over the world through Yoga and other healing methods. Kyoko travels to Japanand other parts of the world regularly to teach in conferences, retreats, and trains teachers for her 200-hour Yoga Alliance Teacher Training. Kyoko is certified in Dharma Mittra (500 hours), Yoga Tune Up™, AcroYoga™ and Circus Yoga™. Kyoko is known for her fun, creative and loving teaching style. She helps her students to unravel themselves by becoming deeply in touch with their spirit. www.kyokojasper.com/

Trinity offers various events such as Transformational Dance, Partner Yoga and Thai Massage workshops to name a few. Basically anything that is unique, nurturing and fun. Join her Meetup group to stay informed of future events- www.meetup.com/thedancingpath/


The Dancing Path™ is excited and grateful to have

the following sponsors for this event-

Love Grace™products are certified organic, cold-pressed and full of love. With gourmet juices, smoothies, and elixirs we support our customers in reaching their health goals with ease and excitement. All products at Love Grace™ are chemical-free, dairy-free, Certified vegan, Certified Gluten Free and Kosher. Unlike other heat pasteurized juice, we find our high-pressured and organic juice contains vital nutrients, minerals and biophotonic light energy that will revitalize and energize your body instantly. Our juices and cleanses are made with a cold-press extraction for maximum nutrients, bio-availability and lifespan. Visit their website to find stores in your area that carry Love Grace™- www.lovegracefoods.com/

Raw Chocolate Love™ will be providing complimentary samples of their beyond delicious gluten-free and vegan chocolate. A small bar with a big effect, Raw Chocolate Love is chocolate as it should be: 100% pure, raw, organic, and packed with antioxidants that nourish mind, body and soul. Void of preservatives, flavor extracts, and food coloring, Raw Chocolate Love is vegan, gluten-free, dairy-free and guilt-free, proving that healthy and delicious can go hand-in-hand. Raw Chocolate Love bars and truffles are handmade over very low heat at a small chocolate lab in New York City using only the highest quality superfood ingredients and, of course, Vitamin L (Love). Created with your health and your heart in mind, Raw Chocolate Love is love at first bite. Raw Chocolate Love is available online and in over 90 stores in NYC, Long Island, and New Jersey. www.rawchocolatelovenyc.com

Joel Elfman ~ Hypnotist & Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) Trainer

Joel Elfman (Mind & Body Hypnosis) is a Hypnotist, and Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) trainer with 16 plus years of experience in creating safe spaces for clients to generate lasting change. He has helped hundreds of people become their most amazing self, and transform their old problems into new positive habits, beliefs and ways of enjoying life. Areas of focus include losing weight, building confidence, reducing stress and more. www.joelelfman.com

Limation™will be providing complimentary drink samples. Their delicious Limeade beverage comes in three yummy flavors: Lime, Lavender and Passion Fruit. Charmaine DaCosta, the founder of Limation™, was born in Jamaica. She grew up drinking “lemonade” made with limes and brown sugar. In the fertile “gully” where her grandmother grew various produce, limes, oranges and grapefruit were abundant but lemons were few. The sweet, tart drink, as she remembers it, was delicious, refreshing and altogether satisfying. Imagine her surprise then when she first asked for lemonade in the United States. What she received in no way resembled what she had come to recognize as lemonade, neither in color, taste nor bouquet were they the same. Although she later developed a taste for lemons, she really missed the homegrown version of her favorite drink, so she started making it whenever she would find limes at the market. She started making lemonade for her friends whenever she had a gathering at her house and they all loved it but did not identify it as lemonade. The misnomer corrected to limeade, Charmaine realized that there was a space in the market for a really good limeade drink after having unsuccessfully tried to find one for years. Thus, Limation was born. The ingredients consist of- Freshly squeezed lime juice, organic cane sugar, filtered water and other natural ingredients, minus the preservatives and other naughty additives. Visit the website to find stores in your area that carry Limeade- www.mylimation.com/

Connect with Trinity & The Dancing Path™ at-

www.meetup.com/thedancingpath/

www.facebook.com/thedancingpath/

</a>

You'll also have the chance to meet:

1 Organic Lovers from ""Organic NYC - Food Garden Lifestyle""

5 Meditators from ""Meditation NYC""

1 Powerful Attractors from ""Law of Attraction NYC - Awaken Your Genie""

2 Somnambulists from ""Hypnosis and NLP Experience NYC""

1 Fans of Wellness from ""Holistic Wellness NYC - Outdoor, Yoga, Hiking, Mind, Body""

2 Health Fanatics! from ""Diet, Fitness & Nutrition NYC""

2 Seekers of Truth from ""Cosmic Health NYC - Meditation, Breathe, Spirit, Light""

1 Members from "Holistic and Spiritual Weight Loss Meetup - NY"

1 Fans of Qigong from ""Qigong NYC (aka Chi Kung) - Energy Health Fitness""

1 Powerful Creators from ""Self Empowerment NYC - Achieving Your Greatness""

2 Yogis from ""Yoga Society NYC""

2 Artists of Touch from "Massage NYC - Explore-Touch-Connect"

3 Empowered Creators from "Love, Happiness & Success NYC"

1 Explorers & Seekers from "Healers of Enlightenment & Transformation NYC"

1 Conquerers of Self-Doubt & Fear from "Gain Confidence NYC"

2 MindBody Explorers from "Connecting Mind & Body NYC"

1 Masterminds from "Branding/Marketing Mastermind Group for Solo/Small Business"

1 Explorers of Health from "Alternative Health NYC"

24 NLPers/hypnotists/Coaches from "NLP-Hypnosis NYC"

A total of 38 people are expected to attend!

Edit Linking

Testimonials-“Trinity leads this outrageously fun facilitated celebration with all of her heart, passion, power, and love. By the end, I always feel completely connected with myself and everyone in the room- a deep sense of community is created. It is a profound experience.” ~Doug Larson


“I feel like this is the best time I've had in a while! I came in not knowing what to expect. I left feeling empowered, light, open, centered and free. A lot of things surfaced for me in a wonderful way. I now feel closer to my heart. Thank you!” ~ Melissa D.

====================


About Trinity- Trinity is the creator of the Dancing Path™ a celebratory transformational events organization that offers playful, creative, community building events, workshops and trainings all over NYC. She is passionate about bringing people together to celebrate life, express themselves fully and connect in fun and nurturing ways. One of Trinity’s main passions is to facilitate transformational dance. Her love and uninhibited passion for dance is infectious. Trinity has facilitated transformational dances at the Omega Institute, Princeton University, Jiva Mukti and many other wonderful places. In 2001 she studied Reiki and a few years later became a Reiki master. Shortly after Trinity studied at Institute for Integrative Nutrition (IIN) and got certified as a Holistic Health & Nutritional Counselor. During her studies at IIN she discovered Thai Massage and pursued training with Lotus Palm and in Thailand. Trinity is a 200 hour certified Yoga Instructor and has been teaching yoga for 15 years. She has also studied and been trained in Circus Yoga™, Hawaiian Lomi Lomi Massage, Authentic Relating & Deeksha aka the Oneness Blessing.

About Kyoko-Kyoko Jasper (ERYT) was born and raised in Japan, in 1985, she moved to NYC to become an actress and for over two decades, she has been performing in Musical Theatre, TV and Film. After the devastating day of[masked], led by an undeniable calling in her heart, Kyoko went through a dramatic shift which led her passion to a Yogic way of life. Now she is dedicating herself to spread peace and healing all over the world through Yoga and other healing methods. Kyoko travels to Japanand other parts of the world regularly to teach in conferences, retreats, and trains teachers for her 200-hour Yoga Alliance Teacher Training. Kyoko is certified in Dharma Mittra (500 hours), Yoga Tune Up™, AcroYoga™ and Circus Yoga™. Kyoko is known for her fun, creative and loving teaching style. She helps her students to unravel themselves by becoming deeply in touch with their spirit. www.kyokojasper.com/

Trinity offers various events such as Transformational Dance, Partner Yoga and Thai Massage workshops to name a few. Basically anything that is unique, nurturing and fun. Join her Meetup group to stay informed of future events- www.meetup.com/thedancingpath/


The Dancing Path™ is excited and grateful to have

the following sponsors for this event-

Love Grace™products are certified organic, cold-pressed and full of love. With gourmet juices, smoothies, and elixirs we support our customers in reaching their health goals with ease and excitement. All products at Love Grace™ are chemical-free, dairy-free, Certified vegan, Certified Gluten Free and Kosher. Unlike other heat pasteurized juice, we find our high-pressured and organic juice contains vital nutrients, minerals and biophotonic light energy that will revitalize and energize your body instantly. Our juices and cleanses are made with a cold-press extraction for maximum nutrients, bio-availability and lifespan. Visit their website to find stores in your area that carry Love Grace™- www.lovegracefoods.com/

Raw Chocolate Love™ will be providing complimentary samples of their beyond delicious gluten-free and vegan chocolate. A small bar with a big effect, Raw Chocolate Love is chocolate as it should be: 100% pure, raw, organic, and packed with antioxidants that nourish mind, body and soul. Void of preservatives, flavor extracts, and food coloring, Raw Chocolate Love is vegan, gluten-free, dairy-free and guilt-free, proving that healthy and delicious can go hand-in-hand. Raw Chocolate Love bars and truffles are handmade over very low heat at a small chocolate lab in New York City using only the highest quality superfood ingredients and, of course, Vitamin L (Love). Created with your health and your heart in mind, Raw Chocolate Love is love at first bite. Raw Chocolate Love is available online and in over 90 stores in NYC, Long Island, and New Jersey. www.rawchocolatelovenyc.com

Joel Elfman ~ Hypnotist & Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) Trainer

Joel Elfman (Mind & Body Hypnosis) is a Hypnotist, and Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) trainer with 16 plus years of experience in creating safe spaces for clients to generate lasting change. He has helped hundreds of people become their most amazing self, and transform their old problems into new positive habits, beliefs and ways of enjoying life. Areas of focus include losing weight, building confidence, reducing stress and more. www.joelelfman.com

Limation™will be providing complimentary drink samples. Their delicious Limeade beverage comes in three yummy flavors: Lime, Lavender and Passion Fruit. Charmaine DaCosta, the founder of Limation™, was born in Jamaica. She grew up drinking “lemonade” made with limes and brown sugar. In the fertile “gully” where her grandmother grew various produce, limes, oranges and grapefruit were abundant but lemons were few. The sweet, tart drink, as she remembers it, was delicious, refreshing and altogether satisfying. Imagine her surprise then when she first asked for lemonade in the United States. What she received in no way resembled what she had come to recognize as lemonade, neither in color, taste nor bouquet were they the same. Although she later developed a taste for lemons, she really missed the homegrown version of her favorite drink, so she started making it whenever she would find limes at the market. She started making lemonade for her friends whenever she had a gathering at her house and they all loved it but did not identify it as lemonade. The misnomer corrected to limeade, Charmaine realized that there was a space in the market for a really good limeade drink after having unsuccessfully tried to find one for years. Thus, Limation was born. The ingredients consist of- Freshly squeezed lime juice, organic cane sugar, filtered water and other natural ingredients, minus the preservatives and other naughty additives. Visit the website to find stores in your area that carry Limeade- www.mylimation.com/

results.description:
Dear community,

This Saturday night we highly recommend attending Pure Love ~ A Valentine’s Day Celebration. The night will include Partner Yoga, Transformational Dance, Thai Massage + a Chill After-Party.

This event is for Singles & Couples. It will take place on Saturday, February 13that YogaVida in NYC. My vibrant colleague Trinity is organizing it.

Come solo, with a friend, or your significant otherto celebrate, express and expand the love you have for yourself and others! This event will be a Celebration of all forms of Love- including Self-Love, Friendship and Romantic Love.

No partner is necessary! Everyone will be switching partners throughout the evening. If you prefer to stay with a partner you came with the whole evening that is welcomed as well.

The advance rate ends this Friday so get your tickets soon.

http://pure-love-valentines-celebration.eventbrite.com/?aff=J


Trinity is a vivacious, super fun and passionate holistic events organizer. I have attended several of her events and absolutely love the vibe and how they make me feel even more expressed, alive and connected to myself and others.

Trinity’s past few Valentine’s events have been mixed with half singles and couples. If you come solo you will not feel out of place. It is a very warm and welcoming community. Who knows you may also make a new friend or meet that special someone.


More info & register at-

http://pure-love-valentines-celebration.eventbrite.com/?aff=J


The Dancing Path™

is excited to present-


Pure Love - A Valentine’s Day Celebration

Transformational Dance, Partner Yoga& Thai Massage


+ Chill After Party


Facilitated by

Trinity & Kyoko Jasper


Saturday, February 13th

Doors open 7:45pm


8:00pm - 10pm

Transformational Dance, Partner Yoga & Thai Massage

10pm - 11pm

Chill After Party


Music, Mingling, Drinks & Chocolate

Complimentary Organic Chocolate provided by Raw Chocolate Love™


Complimentary Organic Juice Samples will be offered by Love Grace™

and Limeade drinks provided by Limation™.


===================


Singles, Couples and Friends are all welcome!


We will be celebrating love in all its forms


No partner is necessary!


We will be switching partners throughout the evening.


If you prefer to stay with a partner you came with the whole evening that is welcomed as well

No experience in Dance, Yoga or Thai Massage are necessary!

===================


Yoga Vida

666 Broadway ~ 3rd floor

(between Bleecker & Bond Street)]

Transformational Dance- Trinity will guide us through some free-form fun dance rituals around the theme of love. We will experience a heart dance as well as a special Valentine’s Dance that will help connect everyone in a playful, silly way enabling us to be more in our hearts instead of our heads. Many participants who have shared that they are normally intimidated by dance have shared how they were able to really let go and felt so much more uninhibited during Trinity’s dances.


Partner Yoga-Kyoko will guide us into fun partner yoga poses that will support us in connecting and stretching our bodies, as well as our movement creativity, communication and relationship skills. All levels are welcomed including those who are new to yoga. Doing yoga with a partner enables us to open our bodies more deeply than we could have alone. Plus it is super fun!

Thai Massage-You will practice & experience a simple, fun and restorative Thai Massage sequence that will relax, nurture and further open your body. Thai Massage originated in Thailandabout 2,500 years ago and was originally practiced in Buddhist Temples. It is practiced with Meta (aka loving kindness & compassionate touch). The recipient remains fully clothed throughout the massage and is guided through a series of stretches and hand compressions that are applied to open and balance the energy meridians of the body. It assists in loosening tight muscles and helps to create more overall peace and balance within the body.


Chill After Party- We will mingle with complimentary Organic Juices samples provided by LoveGrace™ and Limeade provided by Limation™. Raw Chocolate Love™ will provide complimentary samples of their beyond delicious organic, gluten-free and vegan chocolate.


Advance Registration is highly recommended!


$35. Advance (register by Friday Feb 12th)

http://pure-love-valentines-celebration.eventbrite.com/?aff=J

$40. Day of (cash at the door)

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the  8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you  NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you  EXPERIENCED DANCERS , there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor

(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes choice of free class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 4 then 'CALL' on the intercom*
results.how_to_find_us: Ask desk to direct you to your Organizers: Lori & Cindi

results.description:
This is a rescheduling of the postponed January 23rd dance.

Celebrating David Bowie's amazing contributions to popular culture, we will be featuring his music peppered through the night. Let's build on the last dance's mind-blowing energy! Awesome, inspiring music to keep your body moving in a friendly, exciting, judgement-free zone. We hope you'll join us on this special night. 

New York Insight Meditation Center 
28 West 27th St., 10th Floor (Buzzer #27) 
NYC

***SCHEDULE***
7:30-8:00 Setup
8:00-10:00 Freestyle dancing
10:00-10:15 Community announcement circle
10:15-11:30 Freestyle dancing continues

***WE NEED VOLUNTEERS***
Pitch in to run the dance! Help with set-up, do a door shift,
or help with take-down, and get $5 off admission - do two of the above and get in free. Suggested donation for entry - $10-15.

***EASY TO GET TO***
Nearby trains: 1, 6, F, M, R, N
Map & Directions: https://goo.gl/maps/FetZv74cKnM2

***FOR THOSE COMING IN BY CAR***
There's on-street parking for those coming in from out of town. Just a short ride in from the Lincoln Tunnel. 

Spread the word!

results.description:
David Trapani will speak, show slides and answer questions at the monthly General Meeting of the Science Fiction Association of Bergen County. Mr Trapani is a hobbyist who has constructed micro-observatories in northern and in central New Jersey to facilitate his photography. His talk will focus on photographing the heavens. His website is http://www.metropolitanskies.com/.

The Science Fiction Association of Bergen County holds its General Meeting the night of the second Sunday of the month. Meetings feature presentations by writers, film makers, scientists and other experts in science fiction and related areas.

Discussions about writing, movies, television, comic books and other media related to science fiction, fantasy and horror are held before the start of the meeting, beginning at 6:30 PM.

The meeting is open to the public. There is no charge if you are attending a General Meeting for the first time. If you have previously attended and do not recall the fee structure, contact SFABCinfo (at) gmail.com.

The Association also sponsors book groups, movie nights, television gatherings, writer critique sessions and other events each month.

Visit www.sfabc.org to learn more about the group.
results.name: Meet AstroPhotographer David Trapani

results.description:
Hello Natural Movers! I want to let you know of the retreat I will be leading this coming February… If you can, let's get out of the cold winter and onto the beautiful beaches and jungles for natural movement and yoga! Here's the info below: Journey Into the Clouds
Finca Las Nubes, Nicaragua

Yoga & Natural Movement
(From Ocean to Clouds)

February 13th – 20th, 2016

Let’s discover our true nature while exploring the paradise of Southern Nicaragua. In this retreat, we will use hatha and vinyasa practices to illuminate our true selves while also venturing into nature to explore how natural movement can allow you to shine in the world.

The retreat will include:
Two yoga practices per day that will incorporate sadhana (daily ritual), vinyasa (flow), pranayama (breath techniques), mantra and meditation. We will focus on yoga philosophies intended to aid in living our dharma (our true path).
We will also take our practice outside with Mov Nat inspired workshops. Mov Nat is a a mindful way of reclaiming our natural human movement capabilities through play outdoors. Optional excursions:

-Hiking and touring the lakes and volcanos nearby
-Surfing
-Horseback riding
-Zipline adventures
-Tour of Finca Las Nubes to explore and learn about this “intentional community” and farm
-Dinner, Dancing, and Shopping in the nearby town of San Juan

The retreat will be based in a villa on the grounds of Finca Las Nubes: an organic, sustainable-practice farm overlooking the bay of San Juan del Sur. The villa is equipped with wi-fi, an infinity pool, hammocks, and comfy beds (with mosquito netting if needed). We’ll have our own gourmet chef for the house to provide us with three delicious meals per day using much of the organic food from right there on the farm!

For more on the location, visit their website: www.FincaLasNubes.com

*A portion of the proceeds of this retreat will be donated to the Diabetes Clinic at Finca Las Nubes which is dedicated to educating about diet, physical activity, and lifestyle, as well as bringing otherwise unavailable medication to those in the community with Diabetes.

Cost of retreat: $1200
Included in the cost:
-Yoga and Mov Nat workshops
-meals
-accommodations
-transportation to and from the airport
-car rental for off-site excursions

Space is Limited!

$500 Deposit Required.
Payment plans available. To book your space and find out more information go to: http://patrickhoganyoga.com/journey-into-the-clouds-2016/

You can also message Patrick from this meet up group!
results.name: Yoga and Mov Nat retreat in Nicaragua!

results.description:
Come meet, mingle and flirt with over 150 singles at our Pre-Valentine's Day Singles Party at Lulu's @ The W Hoboken! We'll have a fun ice breaker game to make it easy for singles to meet. Our event will be the largest and best singles party in town! Love will be in the air and drinks will be flowing...


What to expect:

• Drink specials all night

• DJ & Dancing

• Ice Breakers

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Up to 150 singles (20s, 30s, 40s)

Only $20 online with RSVP. $40 at the door without RSVP if space is available.

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc Jeans ok. Dress stylish. General age range 20s-40s.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have over 150 members attending.

results.description:
Buy Tix Here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/stupid-cupid-in-hoboken-tickets-18878692678 
RSVP Here: http://www.njyp.org/events/stupid-cupid-in-hoboken

Whether you hate it or love it... 
Whether you are single or involved... 
Valentine's Day is coming and so is NJYP's Stupid Cupid Party!

Member Cost: $7.99 Early Bird until 2/6 
$9.99 2/7-2/13, $16.99 at the door 

Non-Member Cost: $20 online and at the door.


Note: Being in the MeetUp group does not make you an NJYP member. You must set up a profile, pay dues, and be approved at <a>www.NJYP.org.</a> If you are not a member, you must select the non-member price or become a member first. 


Join us for our annual Stupid Cupid Party for ALL. This is NOT a singles only event. Come alone, come single, bring your spouse, or leave them at home. There will be flirty decorations, great drink specials, and many members to mingle and dance with. Oh, and everyone MUST wear RED (those who love it) or BLACK (those who hate it) or a COMBO (those who just can't decide) to attend this event.
Specials: $5 Draft Beer and Mixed Drinks

Who can attend: Young professionals, single or married, who are 21-39 years of age.


Dress Code: Wear Red (pink is ok too) or Wear Black or Wear Both You do NOT need to fully be dressed in these colors.

Tickets: There are a limited number of tickets for sale and NO refunds. Tickets are not mailed, but your name will be kept at the door. All sales are final.

Directions: Just TWO blocks from the PATH.
We have the downstairs private during the party.
http://www.room84hoboken.com/

<a href="http://www.nadavlev.com/"></a>Come and meet like-minded singles on the yogic path.
Loving couples are most welcome too.

Saturday, Feb.14, 8:00 PM to 11:00 PM

Discussion topic: Tantric Love

Join us for a spiritual evening of lively discussion, live music, singing, meditation, sharing of vegan food and socializing at the end of the evening.
The fee is a love donation of $5 to $10, and something to eat or drink that is vegan for the group to share  We do need each person to bring something.
CALL US IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT TO BRING!

 

8:00 pm Introductions
8:30 pm Talk & Discussion, Songs, chants, stories, Peace meditation
9:30 pm Being in Community - sharing food, meeting friends, etc.

 

Fee for the evening is your contribution of vegan food to share and/or a suggested $10 donation.

 

RSVP by Sat, 5pm. [masked]

 

Satsang in Indian philosophy means (1) the company of the "highest truth," (2) the company of a guru, or (3) company with an assembly of persons who listen to, talk about, and assimilate the truth. This typically involves listening to or reading scriptures, reflecting on, discussing and assimilating their meaning, meditating on the source of these words, and bringing their meaning into one’s daily life. Contemporary spiritual teachers in the West frequently come from the East but can come from any part of the world.

 

The idea of satsangam was first spread by ancient Rishis such as Vedavyasa and Valmiki who explained its value in numerous ways.

Over 150 singles are expected at our Valentine's Singles Mixer at LuLu's @ The W Hoboken! We'll have a fun ice breaker game to make it easy for singles to meet, and we'll have music at a volume conducive to conversation. Our event will be the largest and best singles party in town! Love will be in the air and drinks will be flowing...

What to expect:

• Drink specials all night

• DJ & Dancing

• Ice Breakers

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Up to 150 singles (20s, 30s, 40s)

Only $20 online with RSVP. $40 at the door without RSVP if space is available.

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc Jeans ok. Dress stylish. General age range 20s-40s.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

results.description:
Have you ever wondered what it takes to capture really awesome photos of the moon, stars and planets? 

Join us at the monthly General Meeting of the Science Fiction Association of Bergen County, for an evening with David Trapani. Mr Trapani is a hobbyist who has constructed micro-observatories in northern and in central New Jersey to facilitate his photography. He will be discussing with us the technology and techniques required to photograph the heavens.

Below are some great examples of his work.

results.description:
Join Us For A PRE-VALENTINE'S DAY PARTY!

Valentine's Day has quickly become one of the busiest holidays for restaurants, clubs and especially store retailers!

This holiday is no longer reserved for just couples. There has been a massive demand for singles anti-valentines day parties or meet your valentines day events! So whether your single or not, you can take advantage of "Love Day"

Doors Open At 8pm

$5 Admission Til 10pm. $10 Admission After 10pm

Admission Includes:

• Free Parking In Their Huge Lot

• DJ Carini & DJ Morgan Mixing 80's, 90's & Top 40

• 1 Free Raffle Ticket For Our Teddy Bear & Prizes Raffle

• A Section For Meetup Members To Mingle At

We Are Expecting A Huge Crowd. Multiple Meetup Groups And Many Non Meetup Singles Will Be In Attendance. 

It's Your Last Chance To Find Your Valentine. Don't Let Him or Her Slip Away!

Ruby Lounge And Parking Is Behind The Holiday Inn Pictured Below.

Off Rt 46 West Make A Right @ The Petco Sign. Go Around The Buildings To The Right And Park In The Big Lot To The Left Of The Hotel Parking Lot.
results.how_to_find_us: Use Ruby Lounge Front Door Entrance - We'll Have A Section For The Group

venue.name: Ethical Brew at The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
ETHICAL BREW is a live music venue located in Teaneck, NJ, dedicated to serving up a quality blend of folk & indie performers in an intimate and welcoming environment. Fifty percent of the proceeds from each show are allocated to funding worthy social action projects and charities selected by the Artist. The remaining 50% are allocated to The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County. Past beneficiaries include whyhunger, Edeyo Foundation (Haiti), Heifer International, Bergen County Sanctuary Committee, Ramapo-Bergen Animal Sanctuary, Doctors Without Borders, Earthjustice.


Pat Wictor and introducing Annika A portion of this performance will be donated  partnered charity to be announced

For Tickets and More Information: www.ethicalbrew.org

Tickets $20 Adults $15 Students in advance -- $25 at the door

PAT WICTOR

Pat Wictor first burst on the folk and acoustic scene as an innovative slide guitarist known for doing fresh and memorable versions of traditional and contemporary songs. He has since become a well-regarded singer and songwriter, writing material grounded in the rural country, gospel, and blues traditions of our nation. An adept improviser and accompanist, he is sought after as a collaborator, sideman and session musician, providing his distinctive slide guitar and vocals on dozens of recordings, most recently on releases by Sloan Wainwright, John Vezner, Joe Crookston and Lipbone Redding.
Recognition and acclaim have followed Pat for years: he won the Falcon Ridge Emerging Artist Showcase, was nominated for Emerging Artist of the Year by the Folk Alliance, was nominated for Gospel Song of the Year by the Independent Music Awards, and was a finalist in the Kerrville New Folk songwriting contest. His CD "Sunset Waltz" reached #2 on the Folk-DJ charts, and "Heaven is so High" and "Waiting for the Water" both reached #4.
In the past year, Pat has been touring nationally as one third of Brother Sun, the powerful harmonizing trio with Joe Jencks and Greg Greenway, garnering festival bookings and a #2 CD on the Folk DJ charts.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=8TOL4jIkzCo

Here's what folks are saying about Pat Wictor ...

"If you can make it to only one concert this year, let it be a show by Brooklyn's own Pat Wictor, who plays heart-felt blues-based roots music like the only begotten son of Bonnie Raitt (same red hair!) and Chris Smither. And unlike blues interpreters who have seen too many stormy Mondays with hellhounds on their trail, Pat is also an excellent songwriter whose new/old compositions will send you on a journey through the old Dock Boggs and Son House 78s. But these aren't old songs, they're originals that, to paraphrase Mr. Smither, are "still flopping around on the deck."
-Jim Motavalli, WPKN, Bridgeport, CT

"Unquestionably, anyone who has ever heard a Wictor show will permanently place him in the company of the best in the genre- Harry Manx, Kelly Joe Phelps and Ed Gerhard."
-Frank Matheis, TheCountryBlues.com

"Pat's Zen-like quality instantly puts the audience at ease, and I'm afraid it underestimates his skills. Like Joe Dimaggio could make a spectacular catch look rudimentary, Pat Wictor delights in sharing original and traditional songs in his unique style. His original songs are gaining a lot of attention and a number of artists are beginning to record him."
-Ron Olesko, WFDU Teaneck, NJ

"...the clarity of his voice is an interesting juxtaposition to the glorious grit of his musicianship.....He manages to creatively absorb the work of others, leaving their musical intentions beautifully intact, while adding his own sonic signature to the mix."
-Ellen Geisel, Dirty Linen

For more about Pat Wicktor: www.patwictor.com/


ANNIKA BENNETT

About Annika

Singer / Songwriter and multi-instrumentalist, Annika Bennett (age 17) has written scores of songs and performed extensively throughout the greater New York metropolitan region.

In 2014, Annika was awarded ASCAP's prestigious Robert Allen Award for excellence in songwriting, and was winner of radio WNYC's Queens Battle of the Boroughs competition. She was a member of Real Women Real Songs (RWRS), a group of 22 women who each wrote a prompted song-a-week for the entirety of 2014. With her song Where I'm Dreaming Of Annika was a semi-finalist in the International Songwriting Competition 2014. Most recently, Annika won the 2015 Your Big Break Contest sponsored by Gold Coast Arts Center.

Along with her sister and two friends (also sisters), Annika has also performed as part of the indie-rock band, Still Saffire, since early 2009 at venues that include Lincoln Center, The Knitting Factory, The Great South Bay Music Festival, The Turning Point, The Chance and The Living Room, just to name a few.

Annika's songwriting is fresh-sounding and original yet draws upon a wide diversity of musical influences. Her songs exemplify a level of craftsmanship and her lyrics a depth of wisdom that belie her youth.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=6KinA3i4rQo

Annika is taking off like a rocket...

Annika chosen for "Emerging Artist Showcase" at Falcon Ridge Folk Festival
August 1, 2015

Annika Wins ASCAP Foundation Robert Allen Award
December 10, 2014

12/10/2014 -- The ASCAP Foundation Robert Allen Award is named in honor of Robert Allen, composer of many classic pop songs, including "It's Not For Me To Say," "Chances Are" and the seasonal favorite, "Home for the Holidays." Funded by a gift from Patty Allen in memory of her husband, this award is presented annually to an aspiring ASCAP songwriter participating in ASCAP's New York Jerry Ragovoy Songwriting Workshop.

Annika on WFUV
August 22, 2014

On Sunday, August 17th, Singer-Songwriter Christine Lavin sat in for John Platt on "City Folk Sunday Breakfast" on WFUV 90.7. She played a couple of Annika's songs, including "Eyes on the Train" off of her new EP "Blind Desire".

Annika Wins Audience Choice Award in the Battle of the Boroughs!
July 4, 2014
Out of the few hundred acts that auditioned for NPR's Battle of the Boroughs 2014, Annika won the Audience Choice Award! In addition to winning the battle for the borough of Queens and placing as a top 5 finalist, she received the greatest number of in-house votes at the Ultimate Battle in the Greene Space.

For more abourt Annika www.annikamusic.com
results.name: Ethical Brew presents Live in Concert: Pat Wictor and introducing: Annika

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator

Two dance studios have merged into one. With 35 years of dance lesions , and dance parties cast into the eithers of New York City, "You Should Be Dancing" and " Dance Manhattan " have merged into one entity..

The evening starts off with a dance lession from 8: pm until 9:pm....( don't miss the dance lesion because it introduces you to  others as you must keep changing partners as you learn the dance steeps).        After the dance lesion you may circulate between 3 dance rooms and .........Hustle -       ballroom - west Coast Swing -  salsa -  and you can always do your own thing. the cost is only $15.00.

To me it  is always an enjoyable evening.  The love of dance is always in the air, and the music is well mixed with a little something for everyone.

Galentine's Day is a time when girls go out and have a good time the day before Valentine's Day.  It's a pre-celebration before settling in for St. Valentine with bae...or maybe it's just a good time time find love before the 14th??? results.description:
Call for all ski or snowboard beginners. Best beginner program and best priced package of all the local ski resorts.

Belleayre now stands as a model in the ski industry. Its continued improvements include the only Catskills Cat-access skiing and snowboarding, the Area 51 terrain park, two progression parks, mogul trails ranging from intermediate to expert bumps and extensive glade skiing. Skier and snowboarder visits have grown from 70,000 in 1995 to more than 175,000 skiers and snowboarders from all over the world. With 55 trails, parks and glades, 8 lifts, including our new High Speed Quad, Belleayre Mountain has certainly evolved from humble, yet promising beginnings into an efficient and growing organization - perfection in progress. For more info, check out the official website.

"The Best Place to Learn to Ski in the East" says SKIING Magazine! (Upper-right corner of this link)

*** Trip plan email via Eventbrite will be sent out 2 to 3 days before the event providing the details. ***

Date: February 14th, 2016 Sunday. Please arrive 30 minutes earlie

Depart 5:45 AM from Brooklyn: (Pacific Branch Library) Southeast corner of 4th Ave. & Pacific St. Brooklyn, NY 11217 Brooklyn, NY 11217 (Map)

Depart 6:30 AM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 7:10 AM from NJ: (NJ Transit Ramsey Route 17) 1 Spring St, Ramsey, NJ 07446 (Map)

Return: Depart from the mountain at 4:30 PM and expect to arrive at NJ at 6:45 PM, NYC at 7:30 PM & Brooklyn at 8:00 PM.

Cost: Includes all mountain lift ticket + bus transportation
This is $17 to $20 off comparing to other bus tours (Please bring $2 tips for the driver)
* Early birds $79 for first 28 spots
* Regular $89 for last 27 spots.
Book early; prices may go up anytime without notices

Additional Cost:
* $30 to upgrade lift ticket to Beginner Package which include lower-mountain lift ticket, rental package (skis or snowboard), helmet & group lesson.
* $39 for Ski or Snowboard Rental Package. Ski Rental Package includes skis, boots, poles & helmet for Ski Rental Package, and Snowboard Rental Package includes snowboard, boots & helmet.

Buy Ticket Here: http://feb142016belleayre.eventbrite.com You can also Chase Quickpay or Venmo me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. When quickpaying, mention trip date, ticket type & boarding location. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) Your spot is NOT confirmed unless payment is received.

Maximum: 55

Transportation: Luxury bus transportation is included.

Refund Policy: 
* Full refund minus $20 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance.
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance. 
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show.
*100% refund if the event is cancelled.

Direction: http://www.belleayre.com/company/direct.htm

Check out more at http://www.belleayre.com/

results.name: A little stretching, a little running, a little exercise, a LOT of camaderie!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
results.name: Sunday at McLaughlin park 8:00 AM

results.description:
Pool session and course review for next Sunday's cert dives.

Print and bring your completed Academics.

SDI DRY SUIT DIVER

The SDI Dry Suit Diver Course will open up a whole new world of diving to you. Many of the diving environments around the world are better experienced in a dry suit. Why? These areas have an abundance of marine life waiting to be seen and photographed – they just happen to be a little colder! Dry suits are also used in tropical water during the cooler months.This course allows the student to develop the knowledge and skills to properly use a dry suit. It will discuss the types of dry suits, accessories, maintenance and how to make basic repairs.

SDI Dry Suit Diver minimum requirements:

Satisfactorily complete the SDI Dry Suit Diver Knowledge Quests.

Complete all open water requirements efficiently

Demonstrate mature and sound judgment concerning dive planning and execution

Course Cost: $229

 Includes: eLearning materials and use of drysuit

How to take this course:

• Pre-registration required. Sign up here and Now or at the Dive Center.

• Complete the dry suit online with: eLearning 


• Then we dive: Open Water Execution 

1. Two dives are required with complete briefs and debriefs by the instructor 

2. Dive plan must include surface interval, maximum no-decompression time, etc. to be figured out and logged 

Required Equipment:

1. Basic open water scuba equipment. 

2. Dry suit with inflator hose, included 


FORMS

If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. Print out and complete 

theSDI General Liability Waiver 

the SDI Medical Info Waiver* and 

the Student Information forms, which must be reviewed by the instructor before you can begin the pool sessions. 

* If you have answered YES to any of the medical questions; Please print out and have your MD complete the following Physician Sign-Off Form
results.name: Drysuit Class starts

results.description:
Whether it's a full moon, something in the water, or everyone cycled and were PMS'ing, last week was full of anarchy especially since I had to leave at noon. Unfortunately we had a couple selfish people that felt it was more important to argue for calls to go their way as opposed to redoing the downs and following the dispute resolution protocols.


If you're not familiar with it, whenever there is a dispute the call will be decided by any outside parties i.e. people on the sidelines. If there aren't any then the respective QBs will make a decision. If it's too close to call then it's a redo. There are no lines, only approximations with the cones and everyone will have a different angle and opinion. Let's not argue and just redo a down.

So here were a few things I noticed:

"The Pass Interference Call" - going forward only the receiver can make a PI call. Your teammates can't call it for you. Hopefully this shuts down some ppl from speaking just because they like the sound of their own voice.

"The Keyshawn Rule" - do not scream at the QB to throw you the ball! You might think you're the best player in the game (you're not) and you have best mismatch (you don't). You are NOT the QB and you're only as good as the trust the QB has in you. If you're screaming for the "damn" ball you are acting selfishly and disrespectfully - thinking you're better than everyone on your team. If I'm QB'ing you're guaranteed to NOT get the ball. There are better ways to communicate with the QB if you think he's not noticing the defense's lapses. Next time someone does that then they'll be placed on notice for this unsportsman-like conduct.

"Too Many Cooks In The Kitchen" - if you want to QB then let me know in the beginning. A primary and backup or co-QB will be assigned for each game. If there are an abundance then ppl that hadn't QB'ed in the first game will be afforded the opportunity the subsequent game. Of course if you suck then you can be supplanted or benched.

"The Hard Tag In An Effort to Dislodge The Ball" - this is two hand touch football. The rule has been instituted that as soon as you tag someone it's a dead ball unless the ball was moving during the tag. I've placed one person on notice for their hard tags last week and I will reinforce it this week. 

"The Disparager" - Since Abe was so public in questioning the "integrity" of the meetup and how he's "going to find a separate meetup" then I no qualms about airing this as well. I care deeply the integrity of this meetup and what we have all built up for a decade now. Of course we're not perfect and I'm all ears to improving in private conversations, however I have no patience for public remarks that disparage our meetup. Frankly I think this tantrum is immature and self deprecating. Maybe you look to Cam Newton as a role model. Normally I would have granted you your wish and booted you out but I'd like to give everyone the benefit of doubt. I think you're better served by learning patience and modesty from other fellow members. Don't misconstrue kindness with weakness; you have been WARNED. If this occurs again then go ahead and find your "better meetup."

At the end of the day this meetup about everyone getting together to play a game we love and the camaraderie from good people. If you think it's more important to win an argument about one or two plays and ruin the "fun" of the game then you need to take a step back and see the big picture. Otherwise people will be fed up and just walk away from you and/or the game.

This week will be cold. If you're man enough for the cold then come join us. If you're going to be full of estrogen and moody then stay home.

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.

RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Hello Everybody,,,, Happy Valentine's Day !   


This Sunday, February 14th at 9:00am, I would like you all to join me for a walk down the Henry Hudson Trail,,,, We haven't done this one in a while. And I know how much you all love it. This is really a fantastic walk for all you New Peeps to join us on. You'll make new friends, get some exercise, and have a wonderful time to boot ! 


• At 8:45am We will Meet in the Big Commuter Parking Lot on The Left that you pass on the way to Sissy's...


This is always a fun walk for all the Newbies to come out and get acquainted with everyone.  This walk has some spectacular views.

Believe it or not there is a little Park off to the side of the trail. Some even call it the "Secret Garden". We can take a quick peek at it if you wish... It only takes a couple of minutes to do it.

We will be walking in an Easterly Direction till we hit the end of the trail at Highlands. Then we'll take a break for a few minutes.... maybe talk about the Great Breakfast we all want to have.  Then we will head on back to our starting point. From there, for those who want to join us for coffee & a bite to eat. We'll probably go into town to the Town & Surf Diner, Which BTW is Very Good, and takes good care of us.

Sneakers may be worn, but You might want to wear Hiking Boots/Shoes for walking on this trail,,,

And.....As always, we will walk in a LIGHT RAIN and Sunshine

Please Remember to Dress for the Weather ! 

• Please Only bring Two-Legged Friends. ! Thank you for understanding. 

• See you all @ 9:00am. And please arrive 10 minutes early so we get started at 9am !

Only A Heavy Rain or Blizzard will Cancel this walk and it will be posted on this page. Those who signed on will be notified By E-mail. If in doubt, check it out. 

CANCELLATIONS Rarely Ever Happen !

• Please Update RSVP's As needed,,,,, Thank you ;~)

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details: 
9:00am, Starbucks in Sunnyside. There will be TWO pace groups! One at an 8:30/9:00 minute-per-mile, and one at 10:00/10:30 minutes-per-mile.


Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance, and familiarize yourself with the posted route map. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short.

IMPORTANT: It's winter, so the water fountains are turned off in all City Parks. Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance as we'd like to make minimal stops. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.
