results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
**Update: Major news: PlayFairNY is able to offer 20 of the dads on the waiting list for Saturday first crack at a pair of FREE tickets for SUNDAY morning**

* Visit our NYC Dads Group website for more events, news and tales from the dad side! * 

This is an incredible opportunity for members of the NYC Dads Group!  Play Fair NY invited 20 NYC Dads Group members along with ONE child to immerse themselves in the first ever PlayFair at the Jacob Javits Center! 


Play Fair presented by LEGO and Nickelodeon is a celebration of play and entertainment for all ages. It’s an immersive, experience-rich event for children, parents, families, and teenage and adult collectors. With hands-on exhibits, awe-inspiring displays, dozens of toy and entertainment brands, and never-before-seen exclusives, attendees can feel, touch, and take home their favorite toys and games — and be the first to glimpse the toys of tomorrow.

LEGO and Nickelodeon Come to Life at Play Fair!

The first ever Play Fair comes to the Javits Center on February 13-14 in New York City! Play Fair will feature the best of toys, games, and family entertainment - like a Comic Con for Kids!


Play Fair is presented by LEGO and Nickelodeon and features Hasbro, Mattel, Cartoon Network, Crayola, Toys"R"Us, and more.  

Kick off February break in the biggest play room ever...

·  Meet the PAW Patrol, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, SpongeBob SquarePants, Peppa Pig, and PJ Masks

·  See the new Batmobile from the upcoming film Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice

·  Build and race your own LEGO car

·  Make comics with award-winning comic creators

·  Watch at the Story Pirates bring children's stories to life

·  Make comics with award-winning comic creators Art Baltazar, Franco Aureliani, Dave Roman, and Abby Denson

·  Snap a selfie with your favorite family YouTubers

We’ll see you at Play Fair!

* 20 NYC Dads Group members will receive a PAIR of tickets (good for dad + 1 kid).  The lucky 20 dads will get a follow up email later Today with detailed instructions on receiving free tix.

* FREE opportunity (a $60 value)

* For those dads who would like to bring family members beyond the 2 free tickets, there is a $5 discount code. To save $5 on each ticket you buy at www.playfairny.com, use code CityDads5.

PlayFair is in Javits North, the newest (and North-most) building in the Javits complex. Enter at West 39th and 11th Ave.

PlayFair will be operating all weekend (Feb 13 and 14) with four different sessions.  NYC Dads Group will be attending session #3 on Sunday, Feb 14 from 9:30am - 1:30pm

results.description:
HI FROM  RICK, DRESS FOR COLD WEATHER ON SUNDAY, THE FERRY FROM NY IS  9:50 or 10:10, 

Ferry to New Jersey, walk the palisades and Hudson River with breath-taking views. A fast paced 6-7 mile walk along the elevated palisades overlooking  New York City  and  the harbor. Start in Weehawken, walk Thru West New York, Guttenberg,  and North Bergen. A nice bathroom at jersey ferry side and  a few bathroom stops along the way.

Climb 182  stairs to top of boulevard east or JFK blvd. walk 3 1/2 miles or so to a narrow road taking us down to the river,t hen walk along river edge on wide paved paths in front of condos back to ferry.  Optional climb the stairs again for a Spanish restaurant and bar with outdoor seating and fantastic city views.  This is a fast paced walk and 182 tough stairs, (no window shopping ) bring water and lunch or power bars, lunch at end of walk app. 1:30. May be too chilly for a lunch stop.  walk is weather dependent ,check meetup site for last minute details,<a>
</a>

Meeting Take the 9:50 or 10:10  New York Waterways ferry at from Manhattans west side at 39 th street to Port Imperial in Weehawken. NJ. seniors round trip fare is $16.50. Reg fare $19.00.  Meet  leader 10:20 on the jersey side out side of ferry terminal. Walkers from jersey can park for free on the access road to ferry  (PERSHING ROAD ,(JUST BELOW CHARRITOES RESTURANT). FREE  PARKING SUNDAYS) and meet at top of stairs, roughly 10:40. CRAZY WEATHER CANCELS non members $ 3:00

We will also pass by the Alexander Hamilton / Aron Burr monument park and walk some gorgeous weehawken side streets.


Leader: Rick  Mohovich Cell[masked]

[masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the $20 annual membership fee, $3 for non-members. Non-members please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike or visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: Hike the Palisades: Hudson River Walk. GREAT NEW YORK CITY VIEWS

results.description:
Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my  class!

WELCOME 2016! 

As we welcome 2016, let's plant the seed and watch it grow together!  While the air is (finally) crisping and the wind is whispering coming of the snowy tides, it's a perfect opportunity to recuperate, hibernate, and seek introspection.  Come slow and quiet down with us in a weekly cozy practice to balance the Vata (movement/air) dosha and learn how you can best take care of yourself in order to blossom in the Spring...  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.  

Extra mats and blocks are limited, kindly bring yours if you have them.


*To offset Meetup Organizer's fees, a suggested donation between $7-10 will be greatly appreciated*

Thank you and please do post any questions.  I hope to see you soon! 

Jennifer ( 500 Hour Yoga Alliance Registered  Teacher)

results.description:
Platform presentation by Dr. John Teehan, Professor and Chair of the Department of Religion at Hofstra University.

The relationship between Darwinian evolution and religion is a famously contentious, even hostile one. However, this popular model does not truly get to the heart of the evolution-religion issue. Today we have a well-developed scientific account of religion that sees belief in God arising naturally from mental tools that evolved to serve the survival needs of our earliest ancestors. This poses a much greater challenge for religion than simply having to re-interpret Genesis. This challenge, however, does not negate religion, nor undermine its significance. Evolutionary accounts of religion uncover a common human experience beneath the diversity of religious traditions. Despite the deep conflicts between religions, each gives expression to a deeper, and commonly shared moral impulse. From this view, religion is an attempt to bring out this common thread of our humanity. This humanistic conception of religion fits comfortably within a Darwinian worldview.

John Teehan holds a Doctorate in Philosophy (Graduate Center, CUNY, 1992).  His main research focus is on the cognitive/evolutionary study of morality and religion, with a special interest in religious morality and religion’s role in conflict. He explored these topics in his book, In the Name of God: The Evolutionary Origins of Religious Ethics and Violence (2010, Wiley-Blackwell). His work is also concerned with the interaction of cognitive-evolutionary theories and the philosophy of religion, particularly as this relates to the Problem of Evil and questions of religious belief. Dr. Teehan is also on the editorial board of Evolutionary Psychological Science, and Associate Editor of Science, Religion and Culture.

Regular Ethical Education classes for children

9:30 a.m. - Colloquy - Self-reflection and meditation on a chosen subject within a nurturing, protected group environment.  Leader's Study.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
http://nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/racism.jpg?itok=JLyJeCgB


Leader Joseph Chuman

Dr. Anne Klaeysen, Leader  presides 

With the coming of Barack Obama, and even several years before, we had reason to believe that at long last America was beginning to put its abominable legacy of racism behind us. After all, such values as "tolerance" and "multiculturalism" were coursing through large segments of American society. But the recent spate of killings of young black men killed by white police officer with impunity, has dramatically  revealed that such optimism was premature. So has increased exposure of the astounding rates of incarceration of black men, and much else. How are we to explain the sheer persistence and endurance of racism that continues to deeply permeate our society?

To try to answer this question, I plan to look at the thought of several major African-American figures in order to frame an understanding of this old but urgent problem that tragically continues to plague American society and undermine our  humanistic ideals and aspirations.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description: No Valentine's Day plans? No problem! Come hang out, lounge, eat, nap, and sauna your heart out at everyone's favorite Korean spa. Groupon for only $26 per person. Or $32 pricing available if you click on special offers on the King spa website. Open 24 hours a day, seven days a week, the Korean spa's massive 40,000-square-foot facility houses multiple floors, which each feature saunas aimed at providing visitors with relaxation and health benefits. Heated to a pore-opening 200 degrees Celsius from burning oak-tree wood, the dome-shaped hot-steam room—bulhanjeungmok in Korean—features floors made of yellow soil and salt that replicate a 500-year-old therapy designed to treat illness and pain. On the complete opposite side of the temperature spectrum, the ice sauna uses freezer-like frosted walls to cool the air around patrons sitting on log stools or standing on their hands. In between hopping from sauna to sauna, visitors may hang out in one of the lounges, get a haircut, or even grab a warm Korean meal or refreshing dessert.

results.description:
Folks, 
Inviting volunteers to join me at the St Xaviers Church Welcome Kithcen on Sunday to serve over 1000 meals to the poor and homeless provided by St Xaviers Pantry.

This is based on the values that we would treat everyone equal,trustworthy, with dignity without any discrimination. We also want to be socially inclusive, including everyone with their preferences, culture and celebrate diversity. We will serve vegetarian dishes. The Soup Kitchen is dependent on volunteers to help work towards sustaining these values our community. If you are interested in being a volunteer, rsvp through this page. You don't have to be particularly skillful, we believe that if you have the passion, that's all that's needed :)


Soup Kitchen provides the aprons, gloves, hairnets. (one can wear their own baseball hat). Long hair need to be tied back unless it all fit in the hair net. We work with you, show you what to do. Please wear something comfortable.

Type of help could vary from coordinating the line, serving meals, Removing empty plates from the table or general helping out. 

Location -

 Church of St. Francis Xavier (Basement Hall)

46 W. 16th Street (Between 6th and 5th Avenue), New York, NY

Time -

11:30 - 3:30 ( You are required to stay till the end)

I will put my number on the meetup wall once we get close to the date. Members might get different responsibilities but will try to work as a group.

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - LET'S GET PHYSICAL

This Improv for Actors workshop will focus on using your body to express yourself more freely and authentically. We will also work on connecting the mind and the body so that you can perform wholly and not just from the neck up.


A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.

Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.


SUGGESTED DONATION: $15* (or whatever you can pay)

*free drink with $15 donation

**most improv classes in NYC cost $35 -50 per class**

results.description: This group is an introduction to the Japanese martial art, Aikido. An introduction to the use of Aikido basics for self defense. Basic movement and techniques will be covered, with a focus on practicality and safety. Learn to use your opponent's strength against them. Develop self confidence and learn proven techniques for self defense. All skill levels welcome and no previous experience required. Wear comfortable clothing and come prepared to sweat. results.description:
Join Grand Central Atelier graduate Allison parker for this three-part Portrait Drawing Intensive. 

In this three-session portrait drawing intensive, students will study the basic anatomy of the skull in order to create a more three-dimensional likeness of the model.  Concepts will include basic composition and gesture to set up the portrait, identifying bony landmarks of the skull, creating a ‘block-in’ or detailed outline, and using careful shading to suggest the unique forms of the portrait.  Students will learn to trouble-shoot their work using basic anatomy and perspective concepts, visual comparisons, and measuring.  Students are encouraged to work in graphite and white chalk on toned paper.    


Day 1- Anatomy of the face, looking for composition and gesture, demo of beginning the block-in. Sunday -February 14th 12-4 pm

Day 2- Refining the block-in to create a likeness and three-dimensional outline. Sunday -February 21st 12-4 pm

Day 3- Identifying a light effect, shading demo, refining the drawing using shades and highlights. Sunday -February 28th 12-4 pm

Instructors Work

Allison Parker completed a four-year course of study in classical drawing and painting at the Grand Central Academy.  Her experience includes many hours of drawing and painting from the live model as well as ecorche´ and anatomical studies.  Ms. Parker holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from the Savannah College of Art and Design in Painting and Illustration.  Her work has received awards from the Salmagundi Club, the New York Society of Illustrators, and American Illustration Magazine.  It has been featured on television as part of the documentary ‘Secrets of New York.’  Allison is a member of Brooklyn Brush Studios in Bushwick, Brooklyn where she paints and teaches privately.

results.name: (Sold Out) Portrait Drawing Intensive, 3-day workshop with Allison Parker

results.description:
NYC ATHEISTS EXCLUSIVE: MEET NYU ANTHROPOLOGIST SCOTT WILLIAMS WHO HELPED IDENTIFY THE NEW SPECIES - (HOMO NALEDI).

----------------------------------------------

SPEAKER: SCOTT WILLIAMS Ph.D

NYU: Assistant Professor of Anthropology - Center for the Study of Human Origins

Areas of Research/Interest:


Human evolution; Evolutionary functional morphology; Fossil hominins; Bipedalism; Trunk; Axial skeleton; Vertebral column.

-------------------------

HOMO NALEDI

Acting on a tip from spelunkers two years ago, scientists in South Africa discovered what the cavers had only dimly glimpsed through a crack in a limestone wall deep in the Rising Star Cave: lots and lots of old bones.The remains covered the earthen floor beyond the narrow opening. This was, the scientists concluded, a large, dark chamber for the dead of a previously unidentified species of the early human lineage — Homo naledi. The species name, H. naledi, refers to the cave where the bones lay undisturbed for so long; “naledi” means “star” in the local Sesotho language.

In what is being hailed as one of the most significant discoveries of the past 50 years, a team of research specialists including two NYU anthropologists has discovered a new species of human ancestors known as Homo naledi in Johannesburg, South Africa.

The team, led by University of Witwatersrand professor Lee Berger, has been conducting expeditions to expand the knowledge gained from new fossils that contribute to the understanding of human origins.

The exploration took place in the Rising Star Cave located at the Cradle of Humankind world heritage site, where explorers found incredible amounts of fossils in a chamber, accessible only through a narrow chute 100 yards from the cave’s entrance.

The 1,500 bones, recovered in late 2013, were incredibly well-preserved and showed no sign of a catastrophic event, suggesting that the previously isolated cave had been used as a burial ground for the dead. This theory is particularly notable because it indicates that Homo naledi may have thought about mortality, a behavior that had been uniquely associated with humans.

Fossils excavated from the site included the complete skeletal structures of infants, children, adults and geriatrics. These discoveries were rare because anthropologists often uncover incompatible parts of various skeletons, rather than an entire anatomical structure.

NYU anthropology assistant professor and research team member Scott Williams identified fossils at the excavation site and led the study of the axial skeleton. Williams said as research continues to occur at the Rising Star Cave, more discoveries are capable of unveiling secrets that can change our perception of human origin and evolution.

“The Rising Star chamber has already produced the largest number of remains attributed to a fossil member of our family than any other on the continent of Africa, and only a small portion of it has been excavated,” Williams said.

--------------------------------

LOCATION: The Press Box Restaurant, 932 Second Avenue (bet. 49th & 50th Sts.) -2nd Floor.


 COST: BRUNCH is $20, which includes a selection of Buffet Entrees, salad, one soft drink, coffee, tax and tip.

===================================

FUTSAL ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS

MUST RSVP ONLINE

Full refunds will be issued only when reservations are cancelled 24 hours before start time (Saturday 12pm) AT LATEST

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time is 12pm and will run until 2:30pm. 


Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING. Defenders with 2 feet inside own forbidden zone equals a penalty shot without a goalie from either opposing corner. Attackers inside opponent's forbidden zone equals loss of pocession. 


We will play 8-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 


Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

results.description:
Single? A veggie/vegan? No need this valentine's day to wallow in misery, blubbering into, and wasting facial tissue made from downed sacred trees from the Borial forests. It's much more ecologically sustain-full and cheerful to join us in our toasty mischief, skarfing French toast at the Maywood Pancake House. Friends, fun, vile gossip, vegan dogma, what more could you ask for?

Maybe, afterwards, some of us will do a movie?

The 'economy' movie theater is Teaneck cinemas. Tickets are under $7.
The 'decadent' movie theater is The Garden State Plaza Theater, 30-something-plex, 3D and IMAX(ed out my credit card) ticket costs that will drain your child's college tuition fund. But the upside is Tutti Fruitti nearby in the mall, in the corridor leading to the theater, and they serve soft serve soy ice cream(not by the sea shore....... yes, i know you just impaled yourself on a pancake iron... post show time, perhaps? (yes, Tutti Fruitti is open Sunday).........

yay or nay........TBD

or, maybe some go just for the soft serve?


BTW, anyone notice the initials for valentine's day is V-D? ~yeah~ (slips on a hazmat suit....... :-p


I also doubt it escaped anyone that this is very last minute. It escaped me, but that's ok, this was arranged by request.

And last, but not least; kindly, beware, if you are going to weep, this, the day of the glaring spotlight that blinds, roughly buffets, leaves bare, humiliated and trembling - the land of Singledom; if you need to disgorge your sinuses, please be cognizant of your hankie's material content; silk beetles were not put on this earth to die for humanity's nasal discharge.  'Tis not vegan.......

Arf!!

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?

Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

________________________________________________________

THIS PERFORMANCE ENHANCING WEEKLY 1.25 HOUR CLASS IS NOT OFFERED ANYWHERE ELSE IN NYC! COME CHECK IT OUT!

Rate-By Cash or Check

First Class $5

Meet Up RSVP $15

Class Card $130/10-Class Card, or $13/class *****BEST DEAL!

Bring a Friend Get a Free Future Class Pass!

Please dress in layers (cool to start) and it's okay to eat prior.  Please message any questions and pass this invite to your friends. Thank you and see ya you on the mat!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12:30-2:30pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Please join Sea Shepherd Conservation Society's New York City chapter for a fundraiser to benefit Sea Shepherd's vital ocean conservation work. Join us for sweet and savory treats to help defend whales, sharks, dolphins, seals, turtles, sea lions, tuna, and all marine wildlife. Please bring tupperware if you wish to take home any of the baked delights.

Sea Shepherd volunteers will be on hand to update you on our current campaigns and explain how to get involved locally, as part of our international ground crews and at sea. Official Sea Shepherd Conservation Society merchandise will be available for purchase as well.

If you would like to bake for the event, please send an email to [masked] for more information or fill out the form at

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MgPGTPBwSbQUBZrj7VT0_x4ea95O1-SfLDvhG5inRiY/edit#gid=0

The bake sale is from 12:30-5:30. MooShoes will be opening its doors to us at 12 PM to set up. If you are bringing food, supplies, etc. PLEASE arrive at the store by 12 PM. We will need time to set up the bake goods as well as our merchandise and literature table.

While baked goods and supplies should be dropped off at 12 PM, we ask that people not come to shop for baked goods or merchandise until 12:30 PM as space is limited.

LABELING: Please prepare a card or print out with the name of the baked goods you have prepared and a note of anything special about it (gluten free, soy free, nuts, etc.) Additionally, please label its container with the same information and attach a piece of paper with the ingredient list, including the ingredients of the products you used to make the baked goods (if it is a product most people would be aware is vegan, please just list brand and any common allergens. e.g.: Follow Your Heart Vegan Cheddar Cheese - soy)

CONTAINERS and UTENSILS: If you want your container back at the end of the bake sale, please label it with your name. If your baked goods require cutting, scooping, tonging, flipping, spatulating or anything else, please bring the appropriate utensils. Please label them if you want them back and please either pick up the containers and utensils around 5:30 PM or make arrangements for someone to pick them up for you.

Please note that all baked goods contributed to the Whalentine’s Day bake sale should be vegan (i.e.: containing no animal products including, but not limited to, meat, eggs, milk, butter and other dairy and honey).
results.name: Whalentine's Day Bake Sale: A Benefit for Sea Shepherd Conservation Society

results.description:
Great news! Time for another Tarot Party with Lorraine!  Read all about her below.

The cost is going to be $30 for a sample reading (aprox 15 minutes) but trust me she can get a lot of info to you in that amount of time and you are free to bring a recording device too! Mainly she will focus on what's going on around you right now and whats coming in the next few months. Knowledge is power and know that YOU always have the power to change what you see and do not like!

She is available to read from 1 - 5:00 pm. So please remember its VERY important to keep your RSVP's current. .As you arrive and pay I put you on the list and you are read in that order so if you arrive a little later it will still work out. No worries! *note* please come to side door not front door, and when its your turn you can either go down the inside or outside stairs to the basement.

I hope you can make it!  Love, Cassie

Lorraine Henrich

Since she was a child, Lorraine has been connected to the spiritual realms and her first dreams about the future of the planet occurred before she was five years old. In fact it was her visions that led her to her studies within the The Mystery school in 1998 where she has studied the ancient and sacred techniques of Healing Shamanism and psychism.

It is Lorraine’s mission to shift the collective consciousness by assisting others with the achievement of all goals including successful relationships with the self and others, heightened spirituality, self discovery, and manifesting joy in life.
She is also dedicated to restoring a sense of spiritual community and works on creating a strong foundation for others in many ways including; teachings on transformation Magick, Self Empowerment, and Success. Lorraine has studied all over the world in such remote locations as England, Japan, Tasmania, Australia, and South America. She teaches throughout the US, Canada, Ireland, The Caribbean South Africa, Brazil and Japan.

Her insightful mind and the ability to “direct channel” in the moment are abilities that make her unique in this work.Lorraine resides in NJ with her adorable cat. She holds a BA in English/ Education K-12 and has had several of her articles published in the USA and Canada. She is a Magister Templi, Kabbalah instructor,Celtic Shaman, High Priestess and initiated guide .

www.treeoflighthc.com <a>[masked]</a> [masked]

Services offered: Tarot, Psychic Readings, Etheric Surgery, 11th Codon Readings,En Sofic Ray Healing, Hermetic Soul Retrieval, Supernal Body Activation, Aura Cleansing, Enochian Healing, Kabbalistic Healing, Isis Healing, Laying of the Stones, Sylph Healing, Wand Healing, and Spiritual Counseling

Lorraine Henrich

Since she was a child, Lorraine has been connected to the spiritual realms and her first dreams about the future of the planet occurred before she was five years old. In fact it was her visions that led her to her studies within the The Mystery school in 1998 where she has studied the ancient and sacred techniques of Healing Shamanism and psychism.

It is Lorraine’s mission to shift the collective consciousness by assisting others with the achievement of all goals including successful relationships with the self and others, heightened spirituality, self discovery, and manifesting joy in life.

She is also dedicated to restoring a sense of spiritual community and works on creating a strong foundation for others in many ways including; teachings on transformation Magick, Self Empowerment, and Success. Lorraine has studied all over the world in such remote locations as England, Japan, Tasmania, Australia, and South America. She teaches throughout the US, Canada, Ireland, The Caribbean South Africa, Brazil and Japan.

Her insightful mind and the ability to “direct channel” in the moment are abilities that make her unique in this work.Lorraine resides in NJ with her adorable cat. She holds a BA in English/ Education K-12 and has had several of her articles published in the USA and Canada. She is a Magister Templi, Kabbalah instructor,Celtic Shaman, High Priestess and initiated guide .

results.description:
PLEASE READ/※以下のイベント詳細を読んで下さい※

You asked for it and we're delivering it! We're presenting an anisong-only event this Valentine's Day! This isn't just for self-identifying geeks, it's for people who enjoyed anime as children, and people who have nostalgic feelings towards the medium; we welcome you all! ^_^

待ち望んだあのイベントをやっと開催します！今年のバレンタインデーはミートアップのテーマがアニソンです！自称ヲタはもちろん、子供の頃にアニメを見た人、アニメを懐かしく思う人、皆さんを歓迎します！((´∀｀))

Group Rules

1) This is a Japanese-English karaoke group, which means you must sing at least one or two songs in Japanese.  Please do not join if you only want to sing English songs.

2) Please RSVP or make sure it is okay with the organizer first before coming.  This is due to room-size limitations. The organizers reserve the right to deny entry to anyone who shows up without notice.

3) Please bring ID with you to prove that you are over 21 years of age. 

4) Please go in clockwise order one by one when selecting songs to sing, so everyone has an equal opportunity.  This also makes it easy to tell if your song is skipped (in which case you can choose two songs upon your next turn).  Please try to locate your song choice before getting the remote to keep it moving along (https://www.clubdam.com/app/search/searchKeywordKaraoke.html).  As soon as you enter your song, please pass the remote directly to the next person, and let them know it is their turn. 

5) Please tip the staff at karaoke.

6) If you leave an early, please give your payment (including tip) to the organizer, who will take care of the bill at the end.  Please bring cash with you to make splitting bills and tipping easier.

7) If you are a no-show, you are subject to removal from the group.  It is understandable if something comes up and you cannot make it, but when this happens, please either email the organizer or change your status on the event page to "not attending".

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

Dear Dharma Friends,

We will be holding a moving and sitting meditation followed by a Dharma talk on what is Zen.

1:00 - 2:00 Sitting/moving meditation

The lecture will be given by teacher Harry Miller.  Harry  studied  with  Master  Sheng  Yen  for  over  30  years.  He  was  editor  of  the  Chan  Newsletter  for  over  10  years,  is  a  frequent  contributor  to  Chan  Magazine,  and  a  lecturer  at  Chan  Meditation  Center (CMC).  He  is  a  board  member  of  Dharma  Drum  Retreat  Center  and  a  member  of  the  Dharma  Teachers  in  Training  at  CMC.  He  holds  a  B.A  in  French  and  English  literature  from  Sarah  Lawrence,  and  an  M.A.  in  Chinese  Literature  and  M.Phil.  in  Comparative  Literature  from  Columbia  University.

Look forward to seeing everyone,

_/|\_

Sound Healing helps to:

• Relieve Stress 

• Calm Emotions

• Clear Your Thoughts

• Deepen Self Awareness

• Enhance Well Being

• Strengthen The Immune System

• Enhance Your Connection To Your Purpose

Sage Logan: is a Musician, Composer. He was raised with family practices of African American folk magic known as Rootwork. He is also a Shamanic Practitioner, and has learned sacred ceremonies, and healing techniques first hand from indigenous healers, from the Lakota & Cherokee traditions, healers from Peru & Ecuador, the Maori of New Zealand, South African Sangoma’s & many more. Sage is an organizer, of the NY Shamanic Circle, NYC’s eldest Shamanic non-profit organization.

results.description:
This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending.  Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group.

HOW MEMBERS SUBMIT NOVEL SECTIONS:



Email your submission to [masked] 

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam
MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.
Send to [masked]

Attach your document. RTF and DOC are preferred. Please, NO PDF's or DOCx. 


What to Expect: Nine days before the meeting you will receive an email from Meetup with links to download each story for critique from our Dropbox account. Click on the link and download the stories.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.


Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next. You can find advice about how to give a critique here.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Cam's Novel Group

results.description:
Kundiman presents a generative writing workshop inspired by the retrospective Martin Wong: Human Instamatic at the Bronx Museum of the Arts. Martin Wong was a visionary painter of queer erotics, mysticism, loneliness, multi-racial intimacy, and urban grit.

Wong’s paintings offer rich worlds for exploration: he captured a singular view of San Francisco and New York’s Lower East side from the 1970s through his untimely death, in 1999, of AIDS. His works are infused with text: he created a sign language alphabet, put Miguel Piñero's poetry to image, and rendered Loisaida graffiti with tenderness.

 Participants in this workshop will receive a guided tour of the exhibition, then create on-site original work inspired by the paintings. The workshop is open to fiction, poetry, and nonfiction writers.

Free and open to the public. Registration required via Eventbrite...see registration link and full details here. You will be asked to share your email address.

2:00–3:00 Guided tour

3:00–4:30 Writing, discussion, workshop 

4:30–5:00 Reading

results.description:
Get tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/paint.html
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

When: Sunday, February 14th 2016: 3:00 to 5:00 PM (Please try to arrive at 2:45 to sign in)
Where: House of Brews - 302 W 51st St. New York, NY

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few more cocktails. You'll get to mingle a bit and make some new friends and also get to enter into a fun raffle for a chance to win a prize!

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend. The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual attendees.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/paint.html

Helene Bergman, violin

Mary Robb, cello
Keiko Asakawa-Golden, piano
Admission by $15 pp suggested donation
[Seniors & Students, $10 pp]
​ In celebration of Valentine’s Day, Brooklyn and Beyond Chamber Ensemble celebrates music for duos, including a performance of Bach’s inventions, played on violin and cello. Though the concert ends with a trio, it showcases music of the Tango, one of the most intimate dances for two. We hope this music will bring love and light to all the duos in your life! Program includes works by Schubert, Fauré, and Piazzolla.

Hello Urban Professionals,


On one of the most romantic days of the year The Network  singles a sexy brunch experience at one of the hottest venues in NYC.

You are invited to the Sweet & Sexy Soul Valentine's Day Brunch

@


MADISON SQUARE TAVERN


150 W. 30st.

N.Y. , N.Y.

FREE ENTRY ON ANGEL'S LIST - RSVP a Must !!!!

Come through to enjoy the best food in town with our signature drinks and specials for bottomless Mimosas and Sangrias.

If you are single come out and mix and mingle with the best urban professionals in NYC and also feel free to take part in the INSTA DATE event taking place in a separate area in this venue.

This Brunch will be amazing and so much fun!

CALLING ALL URBAN PROFESSIONAL SINGLE LADIES AND GENTLEMEN FOR THE OUR FEATURE EVENT BELOW:


As New York City's leader in Urban Professional events, The Network's partner company INSTA DATE is the preferred choice for minority professional men and women that are seeking love and friendship. Our events have become the most successful and talked-about Instant dating events in NYC!

Our clients are professional, busy men and women who live in the NY area, including the 5 boroughs and Long Island, Westchester, and many parts of New Jersey. Our events offer an ingenious way for single men and women to meet each other. We bring them together in one place to meet, mingle, and see if there are matches between them. The result is a completely energetic and fun-filled event where strangers can become fast friends and more.

So fella's bring your friends and ladies bring your girls to come out and have some fun with the hottest urban professionals in NYC for FREE!!!

We have established a great relationship with many of today's most popular venues, allowing us to provide our clients with safe and comfortable environments to meet and have fun.

STRICTLY TANGO presents…

VALENTINE’S WINE AND TANGO AFTERNOON PARTY
Sunday February 14th

This Valentine’s Day discover the passion and romance of the tango with your special someone. Strictly Tango, the premiere NYC school for Argentine Tango, is offering two events on Valentines Day. Both events will cater to couples totally new to tango as well as to couples with a little more experience.

Our afternoon event is from 3:30pm to 5:00 pm. We’ll begin the party with an introductory class focused on connecting with your partner and communicating without words. Enjoy a champagne cocktail, light snacks and music. We’ll give you plenty of time to practice with your Valentine.

Enjoy the greatest dance of love on the biggest day of love!

The events take place at Pearl Studios, 500 Eighth Av. 4th Fl. NYC, Room 409

PRICES:

Afternoon Bubbly & Tango (3:30-5pm):
$80 ($65 before Feb 1st) per couple

Dress code: Casual attire, red attire or come as you are.

Purchase your tickets here:
http://learnargentinetango.com/valentines-wine-and-tango-party/

Refund Policy:
- If the event is cancelled or re-scheduled, we offer 100% refund
- If guest cancels 7 days in advance, we offer 100% refund
- If guest cancels 48 hours in advance, we offer 50% refund
- IF guest cancels on the day of the event or the day before we DO NOTrefund.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
Valentines Day can be quite tricky for the singles crowd but that's no reason to be stuck in the house... bored on what has been named "Single Awareness Day". lol Instead lets have a quick date with New York City and each other!

We will be meeting up at 4:40pm (The movie starts at 5:00 pm) at the AMC Village 7 in the Village to watch the hilarious and perfectly fitting movie "How To Be Single". (Below is the official trailer for the movie!)


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=akwGjUeU6YA


*Movie tickets can be purchased at the theater or online at www.amctheatres.com

After the movie you can either head home or we can all go have a drink... it's up to you!

Johnny Utah's is a bar/restaurant that is located 18 minutes away from the theater by train and offers great food and drink specials. In addition, they are the only bar in NYC that has a mechanical bull... which is free to ride all night!

Since it is a Sunday and folks have to go to work the next day I figured that we can head there after the movie and hang around for an hour or 2 and all be heading home by 9 pm. Whatever works for you guys works for me!

Below are the addresses to each location so that all who are interested can google directions from their location. Feel free to let me know if you are interested in going to one or the other location or both! I think this will be a very fun and carefree Valentines Day indeed!


AMC Village 7                                                                   Johnny Utah's

66 3rd Ave. (11th St.) 10003                                           25 W. 51st St. 10019

Feel free to email me at [masked] if you have any questions, suggestions or comments!

results.description:
Let's get together and talk about poly, our poly lives, support each other in dealing with poly issues, and above all, have fun. We meet between 5:00 and 7:00 If enough folks are interested, we can continue the discussion after the meeting over dinner at a nearby restaurant. Potluck snacks are welcome. We ask a donation of $5 to help cover room rental costs, but no one is turned away because they can't afford it. We want you there more than we want the money.

Note that this meetup is announced here and in several other places, and people sometimes come without signing up, so the signup list bears little resemblance to the actual attendance. All poly, poly curious, and poly friendly people are welcome regardless of sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, race, or any of the other things some groups use to discriminate.
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on the 2nd Floor in Room #2
results.name: Second Sunday Discussion Group

group.name: The New York / New Jersey Polyamory Meetup Group

results.description:
Come meet your potential Valentine at our Mega Speed Dating event. We teamed up with one of the largest singles companies in NYC for this and it's already sold out for Men! 

*Women only (20s & 30s) purchase ticket here ASAP - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/50firstdates/ 

*Each ticket includes FREE admission to our after party at Slate - http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Social/events/228218280/ 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Tickets will NOT be avail at door. This will sell out quickly!

We expect 50 men and 50 women at our event, which will be held at the spacious and gorgeous The Crompton, NYC's newest and hottest venue.  

Each date will be 3 minutes long, and everyone will meet everyone. The next day you will login to site given to you at event and select the people you liked. If the same people pick you, then you will be a "match" and will get each others' contact info. 

Ticket includes complimentary appetizers & drink specials!

*WOMEN (21-39) GET TICKETS HERE ($35) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/50firstdates/

*First 5 WOMEN save $5 by using discount code "5" at checkout

Frequently Asked Questions: 

Is there a dress code? There is no strict dress code, but we recommend you dress to make a good first impression.

What time should I arrive? Check-in btwn 4:30pm-5:00pm 

How many people are attending?  We expect about 50 men and 50 women. We are promoting this event on Meetup and over a dozen other event sites - so the number of registered speed daters is higher than the number showing on our Meetup.  

After speed dating event, we are also hosting"Valentine's Day Largest Singles Party" at SLATE located at 54 W 21st Street. You will receive a FREE ticket so you can attend the party at SLATE afterwards. Over 300 singles have already registered for our party at SLATE.
results.name: 50 First Dates (20s & 30s Speed Dating & Singles After Party) SOLD OUT FOR MEN!

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/
results.how_to_find_us: The cool looking people with laptops, tablets, paper, stone & chisel . . .
results.name: Astoria Writers Write(!)

results.description:
Celebrate a great Vegetarian (or vegan!) Valentine's at Rosemary and Vine!

PLEASE RSVP AND BUY THE TICKETS FOR THE DATE AND TIME THAT WORK BEST FOR YOU BY CLICKING ON THE LINK BELOW!

Book your tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/valentines-dinner-tickets-20975167290

Join us for a delicious Valentine's Dinner! Mediterranean vegetarian food (lots of vegan options!) inspired by cuisines from the Middle East, France, Morocco, Turkey and Italy. Menu is meatless with lots of vegan options. Great selection of cheeses (all vegetable rennet based), beers and wines that pair perfectly with the various cuisines. All food is cooked in our open kitchen and our ingredients are thoughtfully sourced, with local choices when possible. Check out our website at www.rosemaryandvine.com.

Lots of small plates to pick from to start off your meal and several choices for hearty main dishes, including Moroccan Chickpea and Butternut Squash Tagine, Tuscan White Bean, Kale and Sundried Tomato Stew or our popular Falafel plate with house-made turnip pickles to name a few.

Start off with a complimentary glass of our Domaine Collin, a sparkling wine form the Languedoc region in France. Then enjoy a four course dinner of fresh Mediterranean food prepared in our open kitchen with your choice of beverage. Delicious house-made desserts including a coconut milk dark chocolate pudding.

Pick two of our petite appetizers to start off your meal:

Hummus – chickpeas, tahini, garlic and lemon;
Babaganoush - fire roasted eggplant, garlic, lemon juice and zest;
Mouhamara – a roasted red pepper and walnut dip;
Roasted Beets topped with Labneh - a strained yogurt;
Roasted Cauliflower with roasted grapes and capers;
Seasonal Vegetable Slaw;
Petite Falafel – served with pita, pickled turnips, tahini, tomatoes and fresh mint;
Grilled Vegetables with Romesco sauce;
House-Made Pickles;
Herbed Olives;
Crostini of the Day - grilled campagna bread with Ricotta topped with roasted grape tomatoes or cremini mushrooms;

followed by your choice of cazuela (main dish):

Turkish Braised Eggplant – lentils, pomegranate, mint*
Moroccan Vegetable Tagine – Chickpeas, dried apricot, cilantro, almonds*
French Lentil Ragout – caramelized onions, walnuts, feta*
Tuscan White Beans – kale, sundried tomatoes, rosemary;
Falafel – tomato, pickled turnips, radishes, mint, tahini, pita
Fatoush Salad– lettuce, tomato, cucumber, radish, watercress, pita, sumac dressing

*with your choice of Couscous with scallions or Red and White Quinoa or Brown and Wild Rice Blend or Seasonal Greens;

Finish off with one of our desserts:

Lemon Rosemary Cake;
Almond-Arborio Rice Pudding;
Dark Cholocate Pudding with Toasted Almonds;
Phyllo with Compote of Dried Fruit soaked in red wine;
House Baked Biscotti;

We have a great selection of red and white wines to compliment the food, as well as a variety of local and craft beers on draft and bottled.

Here are some of our wines Pinot Noir – Domain Antugnac, Haute Vallee de L’Aude Cabernet Sauvignon – Mas de Daumas Gassac Sauvignon Blanc – Domaine de la Rochette Riesling – Whitecliff, New York State For a full list of wines and beers, please visit our website at www.rosemaryandvine.com

Enjoy this four course dinner with:

a glass of wine for $31;

a beer for $28;

any other beverage for $25.

This dinner is also available on Friday February 12th and Saturday February 13th for those who are not able to make it on Sunday. Book your tickets now! We look forward to seeing you soon!

PLEASE RSVP AND BUY THE TICKETS FOR THE DATE AND TIME THAT WORK BEST FOR YOU BY CLICKING ON THE LINK BELOW!


Book your tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/valentines-dinner-tickets-20975167290
results.name: Valentine's Dinner at Rosemary and Vine! (Available Feb 12, 13, &14)

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:

www.tennis-buffs.com

Sundays, start 7pm
Cost $32, includes tennis and balls
6 Indoor hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.


It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
Join the Uptown Gamers every other Sunday for tabletop games at the Whole Foods dining area on the Upper West Side (Located on the corner of 97th st. and Columbus Ave.). They have excellent tables, great lighting, and minimal noise - perfect for our gaming needs! So bring a game or join in on one. Lets have a little fun before the work week starts. Games we generally like to bring and play are Jamaica, Resistance Avalon, King of Tokyo, 7 Wonders, Manhattan Project etc... Hope to see you there!

Comment and let us know what you'll be bringing or would like to join in on!
results.name: Board Games at Whole Foods (Upper West Side)

results.description:
Hi All,


Thanks for another lovely conversation about The Danish Girl this past Sunday.  A handful of us also continued on to have drinks in the neighborhood, too, which was fun. 

In February, we will discuss The Color Purple by Alice Walker.

After the discussion we will also be having drinks at a nearby bar at 6:15ish - location to be determined.  If you can't snag a RSVP, feel free to join us for drinks/food.


-Book club members get 20% off of our Book Club titles. 

-The owners of Book Culture have asked us to encourage everyone to avoid shopping for books on Amazon.  (They can communicate the arguments against Amazon better than I can.) We are very appreciative of Book Culture for being a community space that welcomes our book club.


See you in February!

Tanmoy + Jessie
results.name: Discuss "The Color Purple" by Alice Walker

results.description:
Whether you're single, dating or married, come celebrate Valentine's Day with the Hope Hill Community. And we're celebrating the only way - the sweet way - with a fun spread of fantastic fruits and delightful desserts. We can't promise you'll meet your future spouse, but we can promise you'll laugh, meet some great people, and walk away with a sugar high.


This is a potluck evening party, so please bring fruit, your favorite dessert (chocolate, cheesecake, tiramisu, etc.), or a complimentary savory side-dish (cheese, bread with dipping spices, etc.). Let us know you're coming, and RSVP below. We look forward to meeting you!

IMPORTANT: Due to Wall Street security, doors will lock 15 minutes after start time, so be sure to be on time. If you come late, please text[masked] or[masked] and we will send someone from the meeting to let you in the door.

http://www.hopehill.com
results.name: Valentine's Evening Party: Fruit & Dessert Potluck

Please join several dozen professionals for the weekly Sunday 5:30 Contemporary Mass at Holy Trinity Church conveniently located on the upper west side of Manhattan!  This mass is a great way to top off your week with relationship building with God and your peers.

Holy Trinity Church

213 West 82nd Street

Between Amsterdam and Broadway

Every Sunday after mass we gather in front of church for some socializing before heading over to a pre decided venue.  Why not become part of a growing, warm, welcoming and cohesive community!

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leaders - Joanne & LD)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 5:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Once again we will be doing a Valentine Day Dinner on Feb 14th. Since it was very successful at Angus Club Steakhouse last year, we will used them again. The food & service was amazing and they handled the crowd very easily without rushing everyone. Angus Club Steakhouse is pretty new to the steak scene but  gets wonderful reviews. This is a bi-level restaurant with a world charm. An average steak entree here is $47. For those who prefer non-meat, they have a wonderful seafood selection. Each couple is responsible for the cost of their own meal. Once again I will be attempting to secure a private room at no extra cost. If you really want to impress your love one, come join us for our Valentine Dinner.

***NOTE*** This is a Sunday event. I did make it a bit earlier to make it convenient.
results.name: 3rd Annual Valentine Day Dinner.

results.description:
NEW LOCATION!! We move to our new, larger location as we begin Season 4. Bigger screen, better audio!

Join us as we continue our THRONES Countdown to Season 6!

This week we have Season 4:


Episode 1 "Two Swords"

Episode 2 "</a><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lion_and_the_Rose">The Lion and the Rose"


All are welcome. If you have never watched Game of Thrones before and want to see what all the fuss is about, come on in and be enlightened. If you are a full fledged Maester trying to survive the Long Night between seasons come join us and watch the marvelous series again. Newbies learn more about Westeros as GOT maester fans discuss the shows and the books.
results.name: Game of Thrones Series Recap- Season 4 Episodes 1 & 2

group.name: New York Game of Thrones Meetup

results.description:
Love Actually is a critically acclaimed annual short film screening event, hosted by New York Film Loft & SCENEPR! on Valentine's Day each year. Love Actually features films from around the globe and all genre of short film. This is our NINTH SUCCESSFUL year running!

Once again we invite you to join us to as we screen an AMAZING group of submissions from all over the globe!

Award-winning filmmakers, producers, iconic music artists and acclaimed actors. That's what we have in store for you at this years event!

SCENEPR screens the best short films about love, sex and romance during our Valentine’s Day screenfest. This is a non-competitive event that takes place Sunday, February 14th, 2016 from 6:00-9pm.

Join us for this wonderful evening of networking, film screenings and dating advice.

SPACE IS LIMITED! NO TICKETS ARE SOLD AT THE DOOR, so be sure to get tickets soon.

SPECIAL GUEST PRESENTER


JANIE HO

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nyfilmloft.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2016%2F02%2FWIPEOUT-1.jpg&sig=ADR2i7_fFgAicUCnlKKYFmHQLffW92NhvA

Adina Howard 20: A Story of Sexual Liberation - 19:59
In 1995, Adina Howard made waves in the world of music with her hit song “Freak Like Me.” Never before had a solo R&B female artist made such a bold and controlling stance sexually through song. Along with becoming one of the highest selling singles and most played music videos on MTV and BET in 1995, Adina Howard’s performance allowed young women of color and future recording artist to express their sexuality without shame.


“Adina Howard 20: A Story of Sexual Liberation” shares Adina’s story through her own words as well as the impact that she made during the 1990s and thereafter through the thoughts of fellow entertainers, educators, feminists, and fans.


The film gives an intellectual look into the inside of the highs and lows of the life a platinum selling artist, whose work has made a lasting impact despite the polarizing feelings towards her.

Director: Gezus Zaire
Born in Cleveland, Ohio and raised in the community of East Cleveland, Gezus Zaire is the founder of the award winning media outlet Rebel Life Media.


He is a nationally published journalist that has worked in television, film and radio. Bringing a diverse field of expertise that ranges from sports, politics, music, activism and history among many other topics, Zaire applies his experience and education to his documentaries to give them a unique feel.


Zaire is a graduate with a Bachelor of Arts & Science in communication from the University of Toledo. He is a member of the National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences, Ohio Valley Chapter.

results.description:
Well after talking to many of members in the group. There have been many of times people have attended events and never get the chance to talk to one another or get the courage to say hello. So , we've decided to create a Valentine's Day Event this year.


This event will allow men and women to sign up. There is no need to find a friend to come with, although you are welcomed to bring a plus on or three. In the past five years of owning this group, I have had numerous conversations with many of you about being single and living in New York. I have volunteered, had dinner and gone on walks with almost all of you, and the truth is, I cannot understand why such great people are still single.


If at any time, you do not see someone you have a crush on in the group (or merely interested in) message and I will see if they are free for that evening. 


There are too many singles in New York to not participate. We will have custom made name tags with like minded labels i.e Outdoorsy, Art-lover, Independent Film Fan, Culture Enthusiast and Music Lover. 


This the one occasion that what you're interested will be the dominant. We will also do my favorite Ally/Cupid. This is where you have to befriend one opposite sex and ask them questions, then together interview others.



Why: Because we need an event

Where: Midtown

When: Sunday February 14, 2016 



Here are the rules:


• When you come in find a name tag


• Introduce yourself to 5 other people 


• Have as much fun as possible


• We have the entire bar area, only!


• Tapas on us, You buy your own alcohol

Bienvenue à la Saint-Valentin


When you arrive there will be a game called Ally-Cupid. This is where everyone is encouraged to speak person they see, it cannot be the person you selected. This must be an opposite sex. You must interview 10 different people. You cannot sit with the person you came in with. You must tell whoever you're speaking to everything you're looking for in a person.  That person you're speaking to, must now walk around and find your secret Cupid.  Once, your ally finds your Cupid, they must disclose everything they've learned about you to your secret cupid. Based on what Cupid knows and what motivated them to invite you, they can tell your ally  they have permission to introduce you. This will give you a chance to speak and spend quality time. 

 


Olisa
results.name: Bienvenue à la Saint-Valentin | Baby it's Cold Outside
