results.description:
This will be the 5th year that we go to Claret on President's day weekend! Always a success, and always entertaining.

We either buy bottles and share (and if you have too much you can always drop out of the sharing), or you can buy by the glass for those who drink less than others!

The theme this year (have to have a theme) is either your favorite impression of one of the Presidential candidates, or your favorite quote from one of them! Come with them ready to go! There is no judgment allowed just fun and laughter.

So, for the novice's, Claret has one of the better wine lists in Queens, and has fabulous food. The wine is Queens priced, and the food is Manhattan priced. They also have the best mac and cheese around (with truffle oil!!!!). Their pizza is good. No one has ever left complaining either.

Also, if anyone is interested in running an event, come to this meetup, we can talk a little on how it will work. And as a note, I will shortly be announcing new assistant organizers who will be on-line to run some of the events. So you will see more events through 2016!

This meet up will have a $3 per person cost, paid at the event to cover meet-up fees! Looking forward to seeing you on Presidents' Day weekend!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
This event is cross-posted to multiple meetup groups. As time progresses you can view this link to see all the people who are RSVP'd (scroll to the bottom). 


2 years' ago on Valentine’s Day we had a blizzard warning which never came but I had to cancel my V-Day Singles Party anyway, bc no one would've come. It was going to be a frigid night and I still wanted to do something so at the last second I came up with the idea to Hand out Coats (and socks) to the Homeless on Valentine's Day and wouldn't ya know it, like 20 people came. It was like 18 beautiful women and 2 guys (hint, hint). It was cross-posted to numerous groups, but you can see the details of the event here. We all met up in the city with hats and gloves and toiletries and socks and a little bit of food and a few other things. The biggest “seller” that night was socks and a lot of people wanted food too, so this is what I'm thinking…


Let’s get together and give to the homeless. Nothing feels better than giving to people that cannot give stuff to themselves + attending an event like this is the best way to meet other good people like you. 

What to bring? First and foremost, you should bring warm stuff like hats and gloves. If you have a warm coat or two you can spare, that would be great. Socks are a big hit too. They love socks. Men's tube socks are good for everyone in the winter. Ziplock bags of toiletries are good too (w/travel toothbrush, toothpaste, and baby wipes). If you would prefer to bring food, I recommend sandwiches and other foods that are convenient to eat. Fruit is good. 

After we're done we'll go get some food and/or drinks somewhere and bask in the warmth of our hearts. Isn't that sweet?  =) 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed; however, we will still go out in snow. Snow is a go. Rain, no go.

results.description:
This event is cross-posted to multiple meetup groups. As time progresses you can view this link to see all the people who are RSVP'd (scroll to the bottom). 


2 years' ago on Valentine’s Day we had a blizzard warning which never came but I had to cancel my V-Day Singles Party anyway, bc no one would've come. It was going to be a frigid night and I still wanted to do something so at the last second I came up with the idea to Hand out Coats (and socks) to the Homeless on Valentine's Day and wouldn't ya know it, like 20 people came. It was like 18 beautiful women and 2 guys (hint, hint). It was cross-posted to numerous groups, but you can see the details of the event here. We all met up in the city with hats and gloves and toiletries and socks and a little bit of food and a few other things. The biggest “seller” that night was socks and a lot of people wanted food too, so this is what I'm thinking… 

Let’s get together and give to the homeless. Nothing feels better than giving to people that cannot give stuff to themselves + attending an event like this is the best way to meet other good people like you. 

What to bring? First and foremost, you should bring warm stuff like hats and gloves. If you have a warm coat or two you can spare, that would be great. Socks are a big hit too. They love socks. Men's tube socks are good for everyone in the winter. Ziplock bags of toiletries are good too (w/travel toothbrush, toothpaste, and baby wipes). If you would prefer to bring food, I recommend sandwiches and other foods that are convenient to eat. Fruit is good. 

After we're done we'll go get some food and/or drinks somewhere and bask in the warmth of our hearts. Isn't that sweet?  =) 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed; however, we will still go out in snow. Snow is a go. Rain, no go. 

$0 - This is a free event hosted by Date Walking

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

results.description:
Update (2/8):  Checking the events page, in most of Manhattan performances of The Vagina Monologues (TVM) predominate. If you've never seen it you should. Funny, shocking, sad and sweet, it will not leave you unmoved. But having seen it half a dozen times in recent years, I'm willing to travel a bit to see other productions by Ensler and the VDAY team. 

The more recent 'A Memory, A Monologue, A Rant, and a Prayer' is being presented at Manhattan College in Riverdale on 2/13. It is free and no reservation is required. First come first seated: http://vspot.vday.org/vday/events/55394

Anyone is welcome to use the VDAY event page and suggest a particular show in the 'comment' space below.


>>> ABOUT VDAY <<<


For the 4th year, the One Billion Rising movement will be hosting and sponsoring events all around the world during the month of February.

As the calendar of local events becomes more firmly fixed, we will post up a few suggested venues. In the meantime, check their site to get the latest updates and please consider participating yourself!


({}) V-Day: Explore Events

One Billion Rising 2016 Campaign Announced:
ESCALATING THE CALL FOR REVOLUTION IN 2016

Today, we announce the 2016 theme: ONE BILLION RISING:

RISE FOR REVOLUTION Listen! Act! Rise!

For the fourth year of the campaign, the One Billion Rising’s global coordinators chose to continue the theme of Revolution as an escalation of the first three stages: One Billion Rising (2013), One Billion Rising for Justice (2014), and One Billion Rising: Revolution (2015).

We’ve danced. We’ve demanded justice. We’ve demanded changes. This year we are radicalising our actions — enlarging, deepening and expanding the revolution. Let’s continue to radically shift consciousness and be braver, bolder, more creative and determined with our actions. Focus on the most marginalised women and girls to bring about true, long lasting change. At their May gathering in New York, the global coordinators developed the call to action announced today.

THE CALL FOR RISE FOR REVOLUTION 2016:
LISTEN! ACT! RISE!
Amplify the Voices of Marginalised Women
Bring National and International Focus to Their Issues
Bring New Artistic Energy to Create This Possibility
Raise Other Issues That Have Not Been as Visible
Amplify REVOLUTION as a Call for System Change
Platform Voices That Have Not Been Heard Within Local Campaigns
Call on People to RISE FOR OTHERS
Call Upon People of Privilege to Rise for Those Who are Not
Create Synergy and Connection
Continue to Call for State Accountability and Justice
Keep Highlighting the Economic Context of Women
Remain INCLUSIVE, INTERSECTIONAL and COMPREHENSIVE
Keep Connecting the BODY with REVOLUTION
Rise for Change and Equality

ESCALATE REVOLUTION. Join us!
results.name: VDAY: Rise For Revolution NYC

results.description:
Speed Dating - Sounds like fun! Register at http://www.pre-dating.com/westchester-speed-dating/  - these events fill up fast! Use code PDPSMU for a $5 discount!

Speed Dating 411


Are you single, hoping to meet someone special, but would rather skip the whole bar routine? Speed dating may be an option. Here's how it works: Interested men and women gather at a predetermined spot. While the women sit at individual tables, the men rotate in 6 minute intervals until they have met and talked to every woman in the room. At the end of the evening, you let the event organizer know which people you are interested in seeing again.  You receive an email within 48 hours with your matches.  What you decide to do next is up to you!

Speed Date Prep

Everybody prepares for dates in different ways, but it is good to have at least some idea of your dating preferences prior to an event. Develop an idea of your likes and dislikes. It may help to make a list -- write down any potential "deal breakers" -- traits or habits that you would never want to find in a person you date. Come up with questions on matters that are important to you.  Make a list of things you like to do in your free time or things that you would like to try or experience. Remember, it never hurts to be a little adventurous and you are looking for a person to possibly share in these adventures.

If I Meet Someone I Really Like, What Happens Next?

You've completed your first speed dating experience; what happens next? You should get your results within 48 hours. Then you'll be staring at email addresses and trying to figure out your next step. Suggest meeting for a drink or a casual event that will take some of the pressure off of you both. If you both went to the speed dating event with friends, suggest a non-speed dating reunion at a local bar where you can hang out and laugh over your shared experience.

So now that you understand Speed Dating and are prepared, have you registered?  

Events are posted in multiple MeetUp Groups, websites, FaceBook pages, and more. This event will fill up!  Your RSVP here is not registration. All attendees must Register for this event at http://www.pre-dating.com/westchester-speed-dating/ . Use code PDPSMU for a $5 discount!

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Jan 24, 2016 - March 6th
Sun
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:  Feb 7th No class!
  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452342

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452358

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135393">

VALENTINE’S WINE AND TANGO EVENING PARTY
Sunday February 14th

This Valentine’s Day discover the passion and romance of the tango with your special someone. Strictly Tango, the premiere NYC school for Argentine Tango, is offering two events on Valentines Day. Both events will cater to couples totally new to tango as well as to couples with a little more experience.

Our evening event is from 7:30pm to 9:45pm. We’ll start the evening off with a class on the tango connection and the sensual embrace. We’ll have live tango music, wines from Argentina, an assortment of delicious desserts, and a performance. Later on in the evening we’ll work on a more sexy sequence of steps ending in a true tango pose.

Enjoy the greatest dance of love on the biggest day of love!

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath.

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program, as well "World Culture Festival". We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program. And we will also get to know more details about the World's biggest peace and medication event, happening in Delhi, India from Mar 11-13th.

 Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

results.description:
5v5 indoor gym soccer

With a smaller field and fewer players on a team, the quick-paced indoor soccer game helps players keep in shape and sharpen skills during the cold winter months. 

Why play with us:

Teammates are highly supportive & everyone gets involved in play.Play is at a good level, but not too competitive. No rough playing is ever tolerated.It's a friendly & diverse group. Meet new people and make new friends.   Share a laugh, conversation, and talk about your favorite soccer player. It's a fun workout indoors. We sometimes go out after our games.

Play according to your own schedule! Frequency of games make it simple. Unlike soccer leagues, there is no commitment for a season.

group.name: #1 NYC Singles Group - Meet, Mix, & Mingle

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.

results.description:
Valentines special at Tagine February 14th!

HAPPY VALENTINES CUPID HITS THE MAGHREB...the most romantic, exotic, chill atmosphere for you and your special someone. Entrance your senses with rose or orange blossom infused sangria, mouth watering Moroccan specialities like Bastilla, Tagines, Merguez and decadent pastries, toasted almonds, honey, cinammon, nutmeg, dark belgium chocolate, mesmerizing bellydancers, fire fancers and a special suprise at midnight. Enjoy a special Valentine's Day 5-course dinner with champagne.

Moroccan Valentines Feast $85/Per person Package Includes:
• Five Course Dinner for Two with Champagne. For Each Diner:
• One Harira or Lentil Soup
• One Moroccan Salad or Spicy Carrot Salad
• One Second Plate (Merguez or Vegetable Briwhat)
• One Entree (Choice of Chicken Mahamar, Lamb Couscous, Bastilla or Vegetarian Option)
• One Halawiyat (a Moroccan Pastry)
• One glass of Premium Champagne ($85/Person payable at Tagine or online )


Call[masked] to reserve your table or you may purchase tickets online.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/valentines-day-dinner-dancing-moroccan-style-tickets-21241444733

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

results.description: Most of us have something that we could improve in our lives or just need a little bit more energy during the cold season. Everybody signing up will receive free distant healing energy. Please message me about the area of your life that needs the energy (healing, goals, well being, relationships, etc) That info will be kept private unless you otherwise desire. There is no physical meetup place for this event. Thank you all for joining the group. Happy Valentine's Day!
results.name: Free Reiki Energy

group.name: New York Healing and Empowerment Center

results.description:
We all know that Valentines day is one of the best days to Go to a Funny Stand up Comedy Show. This meetup is one of the best to meet someone or just hang out with people. As you know most valentines day shows are sold out so RSVP and make sure you make it PLEASE! Last week we met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Schumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Hosted by: Dante Nero, Damien Lemon, Paul Mecurio, Laurie Kilmartin, Jon Laster, Greer Barnes. Need I Say More?!  and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

The tickets are typically like $25 and were getting them free, for valentines day the club is selling packages that are even more expensive, but we still get our tickets free so please make sure to show up. If you will not show up, Please UNRSVP and let another meetup member RSVP and make it to the event otherwise your screwing it up for others so if you RSVP please show up, this is a Valentines day show at Stand Up NY and we want to continue getting free tickets.  Remember its a 2 drink minimum as in any other comedy club, jazz club, it runs around $18, if you dont drink its a 2 soda minimum.

Show Starts at 10pm
results.name: Valentines day Comedy Central Meetup at Stand Up NY Free

Hope you are all well and enjoying the Fall.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

Hope you'll participate in the next Weight Loss Challenge in October!

Hope to see you real soon!

 

All the very best,

Jae

*** If you haven't joined our Facebook group yet, make sure you do! That's where a lot of the action happens: links to our photo albums, extra workouts, happy hours, random funny meme postings, you name it!

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Words

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.

results.name: Presidential Meetup!

results.description:
RSVP's begin Wednesday, February 3rd at 1:00pm.

This guided walking tour is free with voluntary contribution.  Note be prepared to walk close to 5  miles in total.  Bring snacks and have a good breakfast beforehand! For members who have visited these locations or are very familiar please give others a chance!  THANKS!

We'll kick of this President's Day celebration with a stop at birthplace of Theodore Roosevelt - the only native New Yorker U.S. President!  From the very place where George Washington gave his farewell address to his officers at the end of the American Revolution, to Cooper Union where Lincoln made his famous speech, this tour will visit various sites associated with U.S. Presidents. Along the way, we’ll explore the history of NYC past, present and future and visit interesting neighborhoods.  Our adventure includes stops at the Plymouth Church of the Pilgrims in Brooklyn Heights and Fulton Ferry Landing (recounting George Washington and the American’s critical escape from the British in August, 1776).  Back in Manhattan we’ll traverse the Financial District with stops at Federal Hall (America's first Capitol),  and the site of Thomas Jefferson's lower Manhattan home.

We will end with an optional drink and/or lunch at Fraunces Tavern, one of the most historic places in New York City - where Washington gave his farewell address to his officers at a dinner party and also the very building that was essentially the first headquarters of the American government.  The very worthwhile Fraunces Tavern Museum is open all day for $1 admission.


Note we will be taking the subway several times, ending in Lower Manhattan/Financial District.  In addition we will take a ferry from Brooklyn to Wall Street (one way fare is $4 on weekdays).

Neighborhoods include:  Flatiron District, Union Square, NOHO, Brooklyn Heights, Fulton Ferry and the Financial District.

Cheers from Hank!

[masked]

results.name: A President's Day Odyssey: Following in Lincoln and Washington's Footsteps

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
Join Black Girls Do Bike: NYC for this historically significant bicycle tour between 10 African American heritage sites from Harlem to Lower Manhattan. We will visit both popular and unknown sites to reveal the stories of African Americans' determination to create a environment of justice and a legacy of success for themselves after arriving and living in America under unjust circumstances.

This is an educational co-ed ride opportunity for all genders. All New Yorkers on bikes with interest are invited to join us. This is a chill, family-friendly ride. Please leave your racing bikes at home. :)

** THE RIDE **

This ride takes place majorily in the streets in traffic -- with and without bike lanes. All riders should be comfortable and proficient riding in and with the flow of traffic. Estimate distance - 15 miles (stop and go).

** WHAT TO BRING **
- Helmets are REQUIRED on all BGDB rides.
- Dress for the weather. We will stop or dismount at several sites.
- Spare tube and flat fix tools (Metrocard just in case)
- High energy snacks to keep your energy up
- Lock
- Water
- Cash for extra snacks/ post-ride meal

** WEATHER RESCHEDULE DATE: Sunday Feb 21 **
results.name: Black Heritage Ride through Manhattan

results.description:
Time for another Palisades trail run! This run will start at the bus station, go over the bridge, up the Palisades Long Path and back.

I’ll be running at a 10-12 minute/mile pace and aiming for the Alpine Lookout (16 miles round-trip from the bus station). Every pace and distance is welcome, but be prepared to run on your own if you can't find someone who matches yours. Other notable turn-around points include the State Line Cafe (25 miles round-trip), Park Headquarters (19 miles round-trip), Greenbrook Sanctuary (13 miles round-trip), and the Rockefeller Lookout (10 miles round-trip).


Note that if you turn around before the Park Headquarters, you might be looking at up to 13 miles between water sources. Please make sure you plan your hydration accordingly!


If you would like to meet up with us on the New Jersey side, find us at the trail start just over the pedestrian bridge at 10:30am. Please indicate this in your RSVP. 

Note that the George Washington Bridge pedestrian path sometimes closes in inclement weather. If the weather is dicey, please check the Port Authority website or Twitter feed to confirm that the path is open. If it is closed, I will notify the attendees and possibly move the event to Van Cortlandt Park. (NJ folks still welcome to run the Long Path!)


Here’s a map of the trail. The Long Path is marked “A” on the map and is marked with aqua blazes. Please familiarize yourself with the trail map before coming to the run.

Here's a list of landmarks along with their distance from the start on the NJ side.


I’ve also made a Google Map that shows the trail along with several points of interest, including restrooms and places to get water. This map is approximate - do not rely on it for navigation!

As always, please view the group's About page and make sure you understand your responsibilities as an event participant.

Monica Stevenson is an award-winning commercial photographer, fine artist, and director based in New York City and Tryon, North Carolina. Her reputation for lighting mastery and her artisan’s approach to the creative process has been solidly established after working for international brands and agencies.Clients come to Monica for her refined aesthetic, spirited work ethic, and her collaborative nature. Working with her team, she forges enduring relationships with her clients—rooted in the ability to problem solve based on a deep creative knowledge and years of experience. When not hard at work behind a camera, you can find Monica engrossed in her passion for horses and dressage. MonicaStevenson.com

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.
results.name: Chair Yoga Class

results.description:
The Talk:Learn the exact marketing system of leading Silicon Valley apps to supercharge your mobile growth  

Presented by: Nagi Salloum, mobile growth expert in Silicon Valley 

Host: Jeff Robinson

TO REGISTER FOR THIS EVENTCLICK HERE

About the webinar:

Without a well engineered mobile-centric marketing system in place, like 90% of startups, you will most likely struggle to build consistent traction to grow your app before you run out of money (and consequently kill your startup).

In this webinar, you'll learn the exact marketing system of leading Silicon Valley apps, and real-world examples that will help you grow your app even if you don't have a marketing team or a marketing budget.

Some of what you'll learn

• The 6 signs your marketing is killing your startup (without you knowing) and how to fix them.

• The critical 4 stages of marketing you need to master.

• A simple free hack to 40x your installs.

• How to hack Whatsapp to earn free installs

• How to hack the app stores to 5x your organic installs and a lot more.... 

About Nagi: 

Nagihas 12 years of marketing expertise and currently the founder of the Mobile Growth Academy, an online platform that offers mobile startups a step by step guide to help them market and grow their apps. 

Prior to that, Nagi was the head of global product marketing for Tango Messenger, a Silicon Valley company that raised over $350M and has 400M users worldwide. Nagi also served as the Chief Marketing Officer at N2V, a leading internet investment group, a regional marketing executive for Google, and as a regional brand manager for P&G . 

Nagi is also a board member, mentor and advisor to dozens of tech startups in Silicon Valley, Norway, Spain, Portugal, Mexico, UAE, UK, Germany, Egypt, Lebanon and many more..

TO REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT CLICK HERE 

Date: Monday, February 15th

Duration: 60 mins with Q&A

Time: 9am - 10am San Francisco time 

TO REGISTER FOR THIS EVENTCLICK HERE
results.name: Learn How Silicon Valley's Leading Mobile Apps Get So Powerful and Supercharged

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.

results.description:
News & Events:  Week of 2/15/16

CRITICAL ACTION THIS WEEK - VISIT YOUR CONGRESSIONAL REP!


Sunday was Valentine's Day and today is President's Day -- time to tell Congress we're not loving our current President's rotten TPP trade deal! Congress will be on recess all week, so this is a great opportunity to pay a drop-in visit to your member of Congress' district office to express your opposition to TPP and to arrange a scheduled lobby visit for the March Congressional recess.


To learn how to do this, watch the newly recorded webinar Congressional Recess: Take Action vs TPP! To review key talking points on why TPP will benefit the fossil fuel industry and threaten global climate, watch our  January 31st TPP webinar with 350.org's Bill McKibben and the Sierra Club's Ilana Solomon.

 TradeJustice volunteers in a number of Congressional visits are already planning drop-ins. If you'd like to join or arrange a visit to your Representative's office, please email [masked] or call (718) 218-4523. We'll email you a packet of materials to bring to your visit and help you connect with other constituents in your Congressional district who may be able to join you on your visit -- or who may already be arranging one!

Also, today is the deadline to file comments on TPP with the International Trade Commission. Find out how to do this in the online actions section of this newsletter.

ONLINE ACTIONS

Deadline, Monday Feb 15:  Participate in the International Trade Commission Trans‐Pacific Partnership Agreement: Likely Impact on the U.S. Economy and on Specific Industry Sectors

results.description:
If you've never been to Paris or Rome (or even if you have) and you'd be interested in learning about how to join us on this amazing dual city tour then this meetup is for you!

I will be conducting an info session so that you can learn all that there is to know about this trip.

I will be answering questions about what you can expect as a passenger, tourist, and TSOITG member while abroad!

Things that we will cover:

1. Dates

2. Price, deposits and payment plans

3. Destination details

4. Itinerary

5. Roommate and non-roommate bookings

6. FAQs

7. Our dedicated trip website

and more...

We will be meeting at Videology Bar and Cinema in Williamsburg Brooklyn from 4pm - 6pm to discuss all of the trip details. It is important to arrive as early as possible, since I have only rented the space for 2 hours.

The screening room is housed in the private area of a bar so we will be able to hang around and mingle afterwards in the bar area for those of you who are fans of Happy Hours in cool settings. 

All that you have to bring is great energy and any questions that you may have. I look forward to seeing you all and I definitely look forward to traveling the world with you!

The Videology Bar and Cinema is located at 308 Bedford Ave Brooklyn, Ny 11249 and can be reached via the L train. The L train is accessible from the 14th St. Union Square station for those coming from the city!

If you have any questions regarding this meetup and the trip please feel free to email me at [masked].

If you would like to know more about this trip but are unable to attend the info session please email me so that I can get in contact with you!

See you guys soon!

Like our Facebook Page!:

    facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

Join us this Monday at Adorama's event space for a special panel including NYC-based photographers Drew Gurian and Keziban Barry along with Global Creative Director Thomas Shim. The panel will be moderated byViewFind's Andrea Wise! They'll talk about the fundamentals of starting a successful photography business, building a client base, promotion, and tricks of the trade and much more. This is a panel you won't want to miss! Can't make it in person? You can watch this panel LIVE atwww.PhotoBrigade.com.LIVE! Drew Gurian is a New York City based portrait photographer, focusing on the intersection of photography and music culture. His ability to seek out and capture raw, intimate moments is what defines his style. His personal aesthetic has translated seamlessly to brands like Red Bull and Reebok, and has garnered the attention of editorial clients like The Associated Press, Rolling Stone Magazine, VICE and The New York Times. Drew has spent the last ten years traveling the world with his camera, is accustomed to working with productions of all sizes, working quickly under pressure, and staying within budget to deliver memorable and emotionally charged imagery of celebrities in and out of the spotlight. He got his start in the industry traveling the world with world-renowned photographer, Joe McNally for five years, as his first assistant and right-hand man. Logging close to half a million miles in the air, he assisted Joe with client shoots, workshops and conferences around the world, working with tens of thousands of people. DrewGurian.com

Keziban Barry, born in Andover, MA has traversed the globe living in diverse cities across seven different countries. After an early career as a photo editor at National Geographic Adventure Magazine, Keziban dedicated the next part of her career to combining her past documentary experience with her love of art. She developed a photographic mission to capture the cinematic "just before" and "just after" of a momentous action: where subjects and spectators experience the anxiety that awaits an imminent fate or confront the tragic result of a seemingly inescapable reality. Her subjects blend courage with vulnerability, reflecting a life lived across racial, economic and geographic boundaries.Keziban has since been published in Aesthetica, Architectural Digest, Art+Auction, Modern Painters, O Magazine, Musee, among the many. She exhibited in a group show at the International Center of Photography curated by Amy Arbus in 2010 and hosted her first solo exhibition at Norwood, New York City in November, 2013. Keziban currently resides in New York City where she continues to photograph and make short films. KezibanBarry.com

Thomas Shim is an award winning Global Creative Director based in New York City. He is a Creative Director by title but takes all the best qualities of an art director, a filmmaker, and a photographer and roll them into one big ball. He has created 360-integrated campaign for major brands such as Dell, Dos Equis, Heinken, and Durex. Once everything gets put away, you'll find out that his favorite movie is the Carol Reed & Orson Welles classic "The Third Man," that he's a loyal friend, likes kids, rainbows, plushies, long walks on the beach, a little Mozart with a Barolo,and reading Charles Bukowski in front of a roaring fire.

Andrea Wise is curently a photo editor for ViewFind.com, a photojournalism startup aimed at bringing visual stories to a mass audience while helping photojournalists monetize their archives and get commissions. She earned her M.S. in Photography from Syracuse University where she was an Instructional Associate teaching photography and multimedia production to undergraduate and graduate students, as well as Graduate Assistant to Mike Davis, Chair of the Alexia Foundation for World Peace. Her work has been recognized by The National Press Photographers Association and College Photographer of the Year. She's an alum of Eddie Adams Workshop XXVI, The Kalish Visual Editing Workshop, and The Mountain Workshops. AndreaWise.com

results.description:
INTRODUCTION:

The truth about the Keys of Power has long since been discarded as just so much myth and legend. But one of those Keys has just resurfaced and numerous factions are dead-set on possessing it. This means certain doom for the poor souls who've stumbled upon it.

Are these unfortunate souls mere pawns in a greater game? Do they even know of that which fate has cast their way?

If they are truly unaware of the significance of that which they now possess, it would be to their benefit to become aware of it. Fate and destiny have converged upon them and, before long, many will vie to possess the item they hold. Many will seek to become the Keeper of the Keys and our intrepid adventurers stand in their way.

BACKGROUND:

"The Keeper of the Keys" is a home-brewed, Dungeons and Dragons campaign. I am looking to run this campaign as part of the Edison MeetUp group. However, I cannot run/attend a weekly game. My schedule simply does not allow for it.

So I'm setting this group up as a bi-weekly game; sort-of. Specifically, I will schedule a recurring MeetUp for the first and third Monday of each month beginning with February 15th, 2016. I will also schedule a bonus MeetUp for the fifth Monday of those months that have five Mondays. This means our first four meetings will be February 15th & 29th and March 7th & 21st.

I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game.

Each time I've run "The Keeper of the Keys", it's encompassed almost the entirety of the PC's lifespan as adventurers. In other words, if you join and stay in my game, you can be fairly certain it won't end until your character has reached the maximum level of experience.
results.name: The Keeper of the Keys

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

Bergen SEAS (Society for the Education of American Sailors) and Packanack Lake’s Yacht Club are inviting all Bergen SEAS Meetup members to attend a President’s Day Sail at the Clubhouse at 6 pm Monday, February 15th. No need to worry about the winter weather, as Beverly Astles leads us on a fascinating "armchair cruise" presentation about her 7,000 mile, 23-month cruise of the Great American Outer Loop, the interconnected waterways of eastern North America.

This event is free for all Bergen SEAS current and prospective members and families, and will include light refreshments and drinks, networking with the yacht club and SEAS Bergen, and the 1 hour Great Loop presentation. The event will be held at Packanack Lake’s Yacht Club, 52 Lake Drive West, Wayne, NJ 07470 – with free parking out front.

Nyeek Drinks are our game nights at Amity Hall. They're pretty regular, but always check the listings before coming in case we have to cancel or change dates.

Most of the places we play at don't charge us a rental fee. So please keep in mind not to bring outside food or drink, to purchase something from the establishment and to be respectful of the space in general.

There is a game night special that runs from 5 PM to 11 PM for people playing games. In addition to $5.00 drafts on select beers it is also $10.00 for sliders, wings, chicken strips, nachos or traditional pizza. Please note that it $10.00 for the individual items, not for all five.

You’ll be amazed at how much you can get done when you leave the distractions of home and spend a few hours in the company of other writers pounding away at their novels, short stories, screenplays and other works. The ensuring endorphins of accomplishment and sense of community with other writers will make you feel like you just ran a marathon, minus the jello-legs and carb cravings!!

results.description:
Our Next General Meeting is Monday,  February 15, 2016 

6:30 pm.  Registration; Pre-meetings; Members offering deals   

7:30 pm 11th Annual Legal Eagle Night

Spend an evening with a panel of expert NJ attorneys assembled to respond to your questions. Each one specializes in a different area of real estate, ranging from single family houses to commercial properties. What you will learn from this evening alone will more than pay for the cost of your annual MREIA membership!

Harry Frieland, Esq. is a Life Member of MREIA. He has spoken at our general meetings on countless occasions since the 1980s! His topics have ranged from tax sales, the NJ foreclosure process, contract language  and partnerships to bankruptcy. Harry is licensed in NJ, NY, FL and is Of Counsel in the firm of Fein, Such, Kahn and Shepard in Parsippany, New Jersey

He will reply to questions concerning  entities, contract clauses, tax sales, mortgage and tax foreclosures.

Paul Gauer, Esq. has 35 years as a general practice attorney including residential and commercial real estate closings, zoning, wills/estates, bankruptcy, divorce, personal injury and patent/trademark. He is a seminar instructor for real estate licensure and continuing legal education. He will reply to questions concerning closings, title and estates.

Derek Reed, Esq. was MREIA’s featured speaker at our July, August 2012 and November 2015  meetings. He is an associate with Levy, Ehrlich, Gudin & Plaza, with offices in Newark, NJ, Manhattan. Derek concentrates his practice in civil litigation with a focus on real estate related matters. He also an instructor at Rutgers University.   He will reply to questions concerning Landlord-Tenant issues and NJ Real Estate Law.
results.how_to_find_us: Garden State Pky to Exit 131-Metropark
results.name: 11th Annual Legal Eagle Night

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

Looking forward to seeing you there.

results.description:
Happy Valentine's Day, WSSL! Have you always wanted to show your brother, father, husband, lover, son, besty, etc how great WSSL Meetups are? Then join us this February 15th for our annual Valentine's Day co-ed event! Bring your male guest (who will have to register in advance - SEE NOTES FOR NEW SHOOTERS BELOW), but please note that due to overwhelming interest in our Meetups this is restricted to men accompanied by a female member of WSSL only and we will be restricting the co-ed "bring a guest" part of this shoot to only members who have attended past Meetups. Sorry to new shooters, feel free to bring your guests next year, and please contact your organizer, Erin, with any questions about this!

If you've never shot with us before, please note that the mandatory range background check takes approximately 5-7 days to complete, so please read the entire description below and register right away if you would like to join us this month! We love new shooters, so come check us out and learn to shoot!


Have you always wanted to learn how to handle a firearm but didn't know where to start? Or do you have some (or a lot) of experience with guns but don't know where to shoot in the city? Then come join us for WSSL's monthly .22 rifle shoot!  Learn safe and responsible shooting skills with a group of fun and friendly ladies at the Westside Rifle and Pistol Range on February 15th.

Register here at least five days in advance: here: http://www.westsidepistolrange.com/registration.php?referral=WSSL&glemail=rsvp@nycwssl.org 

You will receive a "transaction ID" by e-mail from the Range. Please bring this with you and a photo ID.

Price: $35 (plus tax) to the range. You can pay the range after the event: cash, check or charge. This fee includes classroom safety instruction, private instruction on the firing line, rental of a .22 rifle, one box of ammo (additional ammo is available from WSSL while supplies last; please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo) and eye/ear protection. We also ask that you please donate $5 (or whatever you feel like donating) to WSSL directly to help cover our operating costs like our website fees, locker rental at the range, etc.

Come at 6:15 PM for the club business meeting and help us plan activities -- we have some great excursions in mind -- or join us from 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM for the shooting.

FIRST TIME SHOOTERS (First time shooting with us/Westside):

When you arrive at the Range on WSSL night pick up your brown ID card at the office. (Bring your transaction ID in case your brown ID card has not been prepared.) You will sign in using the Range ID number on your brown ID card every time you attend WSSL. 
You will also need to bring other ID with you to check in on WSSL night. 

RETURNING SHOOTERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
Use the Range ID number on your brown card to sign in when you arrive on WSSL night. 


WESTSIDE RANGE MEMBERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
On WSSL night sign in using your Range membership number. Range members do not pay the $35 WSSL fee, and WSSL will provide ammo while supplies last (please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo). 

ALL SHOOTERS:

If you've registered, but find that you can't attend, please e-mail Lauren at [masked] As soon as poosible so we have an accurate headcount for the Range. 
If you have to cancel at the last minute please call the Range directly at [masked] or [masked]-9448.
results.how_to_find_us: The range is downstairs. Just walk right in and ask for WSSL! See you there!

results.description:
After a great meetup this week, we're ready for the next one. 

• This will be a somewhat structured usability testing session in which the attendees are both participants (test takers) and hosts (test administrators). 

• We'll take turns of about 10-15 minutes each to use other member's products (websites, apps or hardware) and try to give honest feedback. Please be sure to bring your computer/tablet/phone with you so you can have others use your products.

• If you don't have a product of your own, but would like to become more comfortable with usability testing, you can use a website or an app that you like as your test product. Just bring your computer/tablet/phone with the website or application you would like to test.

• Everyone who attends should participate, so no observers. If you're bringing a team member with you, ideally you will both be testing your product separately and comparing notes later on.

Feel free to leave a comment or message me directly if you have any questions.

Looking forward to it!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for David. (Have issues finding us? Call us: 310-980-8093)
results.name: Weekly Usability Testing Workshop

results.description:
Hey Team -- 

So we had an awesome time discussing our artistic visions and goals for 2016 last Meetup. One thing seemed clear: before seeing these goals come to fruition, we need to action, no matter how small. We covered some great ways to go about doing this -- check out a short recap of the things we covered last Meetup. 

So let's give ourselves the grace to be beginners and take babysteps forward! Let's take action and allow for ~ s y n c h r o n i c i t y ~ to open doors towards these goals. And let's use the Artist's Way book not as a chore to be completed, but as a helpful resource to aid us in seeing our artistic visions through. 

And then let's meet on February 15th @ 6:30 pm at PELS to discuss and update each other :) 

Hope to see you then! 

P.S. Do your morning pages ;)
results.how_to_find_us: Take the 2 or the 5 to the Sterling street stop and walk to Empire and Rogers st.
results.name: Taking Steps Towards Our Artistic Goals

results.description:
This month, Paul P. has suggested Teak on the Hudson, a beautifully decorated multi-level bar/restaurant conveniently located across from the Path. 

Teak has something for everyone including seasonal crafted cocktails and an eclectic Asian-Fusion menu with dishes such as specialty sushi rolls, Asian lettuce wraps, avocado egg rolls and General Tso's chicken. And, according to Paul, there's an awesome fish tank on the 1st floor. They have a great deal on Mondays: 50 percent off food in addition to  Happy Hour until 7 p.m. with half-priced drinks! Wow!

Thanks, Paul, for being our host at what's sure to be an enjoyable  outing. Looking forward to seeing "regulars" and newcomers alike.

Hi everyone,

Can you believe we haven't been here since October?  With cool weather, this place is a great place to meet up, because it is unlikely we will be sweltering like we did last summer.   Annie and David are happy to have us back and serve us great beer with excellent burgers and flatbread.

As you recall, this place is very small so we have to stick to the cap here.  You won't be able to miss us when you come in because the place is only one room. 

So if your Valentine's Day is awful, come here to drown your sorrows in the bosom of beer club.    It's good for what ails you!


Cheers,


Bill

6:30 PM: Doors Open


7:00 PM: Open Talk, facilitated by Gordon.
Open Talk is GAAMC's weekly discussion group where our doors are open to everyone. In large groups, we sometimes just get to introduce ourselves and say a few words. In smaller groups, we discuss topics from everyday LGBTIQA life.

This week, at the close of Open Talk, Gordon will also present a BRIEF overview of the Development Committee.

8:00 PM: Post Valentine's LoveFest Social
It’s that time of year again. Whether you’re looking for love, or you’re already one of cupid’s targets, we hope you’ll join us for a fantastic evening of culinary delights, pumpin’ tunes and good times.

This is a pot-luck dessert social. All guests are asked to bring 6-8 servings of their favorite sweet treat. Will it be something warm and gooey or something dark and bittersweet? Or perhaps you’ll drive our taste buds into overdrive with a salty-sweet delight. 

Email [masked] to donate your time or talents. We need set-up, decorating, plating and clean-up help. 

Join John & Mickey and the Social Committee on Monday, February 15th, as GAAMC throws another great party!

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

    facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, WePay fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

Join us for our weekly figure drawing session at The National Arts Club.

This session is open to all levels. Open to the public.

<a>Let us know you're coming.</a> 


We operate on a first come first served basis. Arriving by 6:45 is a good way to guarantee a seat.

• Bring your own drawing supplies.


• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break.

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp!

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes.

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there.

Simon

results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers 
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships 
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions 
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities 
• Develop new resources and capabilities 
• Become clear about your life’s purpose 
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind 
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us. 
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs. 
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses 
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life. 
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you. 
Discover the passion and power that resides within you 
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind 
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies. 
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

Some of us hackers and friends are reading through a Shakespeare play the third Monday evening of every month.
